111.content:
You wake up very early that morning, which was the day after your eighth birthday. Your name is Jaxxon DeJaeger and you are eight years old. You are about four-foot-eight inches tall, you have short black hair and brown eyes, and you're about average-looking. Your friends call you Jax for short. So far, your life has been very "normal" up till now. You always get up early, go to school, come home and you do your homework. You play soccer and tennis after school.

This morning, things are different. You walk into the classroom where Ms. Vanderveld teaches third grade class. You sit all the way in the back of the room, next to your best friend, who is the same age as you, a short, blond boy who goes by the name of Zander Kane. You've known Zander since Kindergarten which is easy to explain since he lives right next door to you as well. Not only that, but Zander has been training karate since age six and he's gotten very good at it. He's your video game partner and protector in school, who always bails you out if you get in trouble. Nobody picks on you when Zander's around!

You like to sit in the back of the classroom because that lets you look out the windows now and then. The classroom was facing the street and the playground, so it gives you a great view of what’s going on outside. You just need to look outside when Mrs. Vanderveld isn’t paying attention to you.

As you glance outside, you spot two men walking on the playground outside. They are quite far way, but for some odd reason; you can hear their voices clearly. You hear their entire conversation. It seems like they are talking about the weather and the traffic being so heavy this morning. It just seemed odd to you that you can hear them so well.

Another man in a nice suit approaches them. The man is carrying a black suitcase. As you stare at the suitcase, for a brief moment, the suitcase becomes transparent and you see papers and pens neatly stored inside of the suitcase, which the man is holding by its handle.

“Huh? What the heck? I’m seeing and hearing things?” you whisper.

“Hey, Jax!” Zander says to you. “What’s going on?”

“Dude… Can you hear what those guys are saying?”

“No… They’re too far away!”

You look over and then you look back at your friend.

“That’s weird…” you whisper.

“What?” Zander asks.

“I can hear every word they’re saying!” you whisper back to him.

“No way!”

He stares at you in amazement.

“Zander! Jaxxon! Please pay attention to class!” Mrs. Vanderveld says to both you and Zander.

You quickly turn around and listen to the teacher, knowing that you’ll have something to discuss with your friend during recess…

122.content:
In a dark cave hidden deep within the Andes Mountains stood the dark, secret and imposing vault which contained the headquarters of a group known as the Dark Alliance. Only - they weren't known. Nobody ever found the vault, and but for a highly secret passage in the obscure cave, even the outer concealed door was inaccessible. Though of course, the group's evil aims necessitated such security arrangements, especially on the occasion of their annual general meeting.

"The Dark Alliance is stronger than ever" hissed a man known only as the Agent "We have now infiltrated the world's major economic and political systems, as well as most of the major social influencers. Operation codename 'take over the world' is going smoothly."

"Operation risks remain" the Secretary reminded him "We must be careful to stick to the plan and not become complacent."

"Indeed" replied the Agent "I don't plan to."

"There is not a man or woman, boy or girl in this world who can stop us now" laughed the Chief softly, fingering a small stone in his hand "Soon, the entire world shall be under my command!"

---

Meanwhile, in a small town some distance away, three girls, best friends, all aged 11, were walking home together after a Girl Guides meeting. The school year was almost at an end and holiday fever was already gripping the town.

"You keen to hang out at the mall this afternoon?" asked Jessica.
"Yeah, we're all going!" chimed in Sophie "Come on, it'll be fun."
"Sorry girls" replied Eve "I've got soccer practice."
Jessica shrugged. "Suit yourself" she sighed.
"Why do you even play soccer?" asked Sophie "It's such a boy's sport."
"You're just jealous that I get all the boys" laughed Eve.
"Whatever" replied Sophie, rolling her eyes "You probably think you get all the boys just because you play in a mixed team."
"I'll tell you all about how it was when you get back from practice" offered Jessica "That way you won't need to miss out on anything."
"Sounds great, thanks!" replied Eve cheerfully "When will I next see you?"
"Well, we've got school tomorrow, but I can call you tonight" added Jessica.
"Oh yeah - last week of school!" cheered Sophie "High five girls!"

The three girls high fived each other and giggled.

"Well, this is my house" said Eve.
"You live in that run down old thing?" asked Sophie.
"Yeah" said Eve "It's a bit of a shack but my mom can't afford much else."
Sophie shrugged. "It's fine" she winked "You should have a sleepover at my house sometime though."
Eve smiled. Sophie's family were known for being quite wealthy.
"Best friend hug" called Jessica, and the three girls engaged in their ritual hug that they always did when they left each other, before Eve left them to go inside her home.

Finding the spare key under the rock where it always was, Eve walked inside and noticed that her single mother still wasn't home from work. She had to work several jobs to support the family, which left Eve alone around the house most of the time. Eve didn't mind though. It meant that she could always go off and have fun adventures that other girls couldn't.

Dashing quickly to her bedroom as soon as she came inside, she drew the curtains and started to get changed into her soccer gear... a tattered old second-hand set of boots, shin guards and green uniform. Then, she went to the bathroom to tie up her long blonde hair, noticing that it felt unusually smooth. Looking in the mirror, she noticed not only that her hair was shinier than it was before, but her brilliant green eyes were too. She leaned up close to the small mirror that stood above the sink to try and get a better view of her eyes and how they seemed to gleam in the artificial bathroom light, when suddenly...

Eve found herself looking right through the wall.

Letting out a brief scream of shock, Eve jumped backwards and fell on to the bathroom floor. For a moment, she had been sure, she had seen beyond the exterior wall of her house and to the lawn outside beyond the bathroom. Yet now, breathing heavily, the wall was solid as it ever was. She cautiously got up and tapped the wall to be sure. Indeed - no question about it - nothing was different about the wall at all. Eve looked around, wondering if it was some kind of a fluke. Once again, she cautiously tried to look beyond the wall, experimentally trying to focus just a little bit beyond where the mirror was.

Slowly, but surely, the wall blurred away from her vision, and Eve found herself looking right through the wall. Eve put forward her hand again to feel that the wall was still solid - and it was. She was looking through the wall.

"Oh my God..." she whispered to herself as she considered how cool that was.

Deciding to test the power just a little bit further, she decided to try to look through other walls, doing a full scan of her house. Sure enough, she found herself able to look into any given room. She started to notice that faraway or thicker walls were more difficult for her to focus through, but it wasn't really a trouble at all. She even looked inside the walls and amused herself for a moment with following the plumbing and wiring of her house around. She tried looking through her own clothes, into a cactus plant that her mother had in the bathroom... going back to her room, she discovered she could even read pages from a book merely by looking at the cover with a bit of practice.

"This is amazing" she said as she refocused back on to her normal room "I've got to tell Jess and Sophie about this!"

For a moment she wasn't sure where she'd left her cellphone but, using her new power, quickly found it lying around in the living room after another quick scan around the house. She happily skipped to the living room, finding the cellphone exactly where she'd seen it. Picking it up, she relished the opportunity to take a look at all the little circuits inside her cellphone with a giggle, before refocusing to look at her screen.

"Is that the time!?" she shouted as she looked at the little clock on her phone "Looks like I must have gotten carried away with all this..."

Turning towards the park where she practiced, she squinted as hard as she could to see that her team mates had already started arriving. Wasting little time, she started to run out of the house, before remembering that she still had to put the key back and still do up her hair. With another quick scan to remind herself where she'd left it, she hid the key, did her hair, locked the door, and started running down the street to get to practice. "Coach is going to be so annoyed at me when I'm late" she said to herself as she ran.

1221.content:
Eve arrived at the park and found that she wasn't actually as late as she thought she would be. In addition, even though she thought she had been running pretty fast, she didn't feel tired at all. In fact, she felt already warmed up and ready for practice. For the most part, though, Eve had been too distracted with playing with her new power to notice anything unusual about that. It had been fun seeing inside everybody's homes as she had run past.

Coach Bricks blew his whistle and all the nine boys and five girls stood to attention. "Alright, we're all here, we can start now!" he bellowed "Warm up exercises everyone! Copy all these stretches as I do them!"

With a collective groan, the whole team stood around and started copying the coach's stretches. Eve got bored quickly, as her body seemed already more than warmed up. Soon enough she'd looked through everything nearby, and as bursting as she was to tell everyone about her power, she also knew better than to interrupt the coach. Coach Bricks hated it when people interrupted him. He was a good coach though.

"Alright, ball skills!" yelled the coach, blowing his whistle again "Everybody, I want you to get a ball out of that bag over there, and dribble it across the pitch and back, staying in line with the rest of the team. Go!"

Once again all the kids got moving on the coach's command. As Eve dribbled her ball across the pitch, she noticed that her teammates seemed slower than she remembered them. Soon her mind was wandering again, as she wondered what Jess and Sophie were up to at the mall.

Just then, very softly at first but increasingly clearly, she heard some voices in the distance. It was Jessica and Sophie!
"Wow, check out that shirt!" Jessica was saying excitedly.
"Told you this store was the best" replied Sophie.
"This shirt is totally rad. I wish I could buy it." continued Jessica, a little more sadly.
"You want this shirt?" said Sophie, and Eve could practically hear her pulling out her designer wallet.
"Well, actually I was thinking this one will look good on Eve" responded Jessica nervously.
Sophie laughed. "Yeah it would! I'll get it for her, no problem. She'll love it!"
"Must be nice to be able to walk around with a huge wad of cash like you always do..." muttered Jessica.

Eve got excited. Was she really hearing what her friends were up to? There was no way that could be possible - could it? Because that would be amazing. Eve supposed there was only one way to check. Using her new vision powers, she turned her head in the direction of the store and focused really hard to see if she could catch a glimpse of her friends.

She was snapped out of it in a flash by the blow of the coach's whistle. "Eve!" bellowed Coach Bricks "Come back here!"

Just then Eve realized that she'd lost her concentration, being too wrapped up in using her powers, and had jogged with the ball all the way to the other side of the field, far beyond the pitch. "I'm sorry, I'm sorry!" she repeated as she ran back to her teammates.

"Eve, you're acting strange today. You're never usually late to practice and when I say you should run with the group, I mean that you should run with the group. Is that clear?" asked the Coach.
"Yeah, coach. I'm sorry coach." muffled Eve, a little dejectedly, and making a mental note to try not to use her new powers too much. Still, she was incredibly curious as to whether she had actually heard her friends or not.

"Alright Eve, you're usually good, so I'll let you off with a warning" said the coach "Don't let that happen again. In the game of soccer, you have to keep your eyes on the ball and know what's happening around you at all times."
"I'm really sorry coach" continued Eve "I promise, this will really be the last time!"

---

The agent and the secretary flew back together on a top-secret private jet.

"The chief was looking chipper" remarked the agent.
"Don't get complacent" warned the secretary "who knows, a superhero could arise a wreck our plans."
The agent laughed. "You've been watching too many movies. Superheroes aren't real! They're scientifically impossible. In reality, we evildoers can do whatever we like, whenever we like. It's just one of the perks of being a bad guy."
The secretary shrugged and turned a cold shoulder to the agent. "Don't get complacent."

---

As soon as practice was over, Eve started going back home. She couldn't wait to see if she had super hearing now as well. Of course she no longer was sure where her friends were, as no matter how hard she listened she could no longer hear them, although she could hear other voices and other conversations quite clearly. In fact at one point she was even sure she could hear the radio waves in the air if she focused for a moment.

She continued her walk home thinking that it might be weird if she moved her head around looking for her friends in all directions, but that she could practice looking through things a little bit again. She started practicing on mailboxes, trying to quickly read people's mail as she passed. She giggled as she read a love note from somebody's sweetheart. It started to annoy her reading all the junk mail around the neighbourhood though. For some reason she'd assumed that only her family got it.

As she practiced her power, she noticed that she wasn't just focusing through things - she was actually instinctively focusing in on things. It dawned on her that her eyes actually had no problem seeing faraway things in minute detail, as though they were extremely powerful telescopes. She had no trouble zooming even further in, she realized, first seeing the individual ink drops on a certain letter, and then zooming in further to see individual bacteria crawling around on the surface.

Just then, she suddenly bumped into a lampost. It didn't hurt at all but it probably looked silly.
"Watch where you're going!" called an old lady across the street.
"Sorry!" Eve called back. She REALLY had to stop over-using her powers, difficult though that was.

When she arrived home, she rapidly found the hidden spare key and dashed inside, finding her cellphone where she'd left it. In a flash she called up Jessie.
"Hey, Jessie here"
"Hey Jessie, it's Eve. How was the shopping trip?"
"Oh, you will NOT believe what we found!"
"Yeah - well you won't believe what I've discovered either. Did you find me a new shirt?"
"What? How did you know?"
"Did Sophie pay for the shirt?"
"Well of course, yeah... but honestly, how did you know we got you a shirt?"
"I heard you as you bought it."
"What? Were you stalking us in the store or something? That's so creepy!"
"No no! It isn't like that, see, I've been developing these powers..."

And with that, Eve started to explain to Jessica everything.

Eve removed her blindfold and earmuffs just as her mother pulled into the garage. "Hi Mom!" she said excitedly as her mother opened the car door.
"Hey Eve" was her mother's reply "You look different."
"Different? How?"
Her mother paused for a moment. "I can't really place it. You're more radiant, somehow. Like you've just had a makeover or at least a facial or something."
"No" smiled Eve, though she vaguely remembered how that had been what had alerted her to her powers in the first place "But I've found something way cooler."
"Oh really? What?"
"You're not going to believe this!"

"Mom, I... I've got super powers!"

Her mother's reaction was somewhat unexpected. She quickly picked Eve up and hugged her really tightly. Eve also needed no powers to see her mother let out a tear from her eye.
"That's so cool" whispered her mother.
"I know" whispered Eve back.
"You're finally growing up" replied her mother, letting her down out of the hug "There's some grocery in the back seat, could you carry it in for me please sweetie?"
"Sure!" replied Eve, quick to go past her mother to get the shopping.

"So tell me all about it!" said her mother full of excitement, and she listened to Eve's story as Eve started putting away the groceries.

When Eve was finished, her mother was still filled with joy. "Do you know why you're getting these powers?" she asked Eve.
Eve crashed on the couch, taking off her shin guards. "No. Do you?"
"Well - yes. I knew this would happen one day around now."
"Really?" replied Eve, sitting up.

"Yeah. You know, your father didn't really die. He was an alien. There was a great spaceship passing by and he fell in love and sort of ... abducted me. He was amazingly good looking though. Just like an impossibly hot guy. Got me pregnant instantly. Apparently he was also an alien scientist. Humans and aliens both have their individual weaknesses, but he theorized that when combined, the child would eventually develop basically unlimited power."
"Unlimited?"
"That's right. You'll find your powers will naturally grow rapidly over the next few years. But with training you can get them faster and practice controlling them better. Your instinct is to use your powers all the time, and that's because your body is just getting used to them. Here - I got you this."

Her mother went down to the boot of her car to reveal a hidden compartment that Eve had never noticed before. Inside was a white and silver spandex costume with a giant silver E on the front.
"A superhero costume?" asked Eve.
"Do you want it?" asked her mother in reply "You're going to be Eve - Protector of the Universe. You'll probably want a costume to match that. It's also really stretchy so it'll grow as you get older."
"Yes please!" replied Eve "Can I try it on?"
"Of course!" replied her mother.

Eve wasted no time in taking the costume and running to her room with it. She quickly disrobed out of her soccer gear and put on her new skin-tight costume. It felt great - light and comfortable. She also liked how it seemed to shine out in all directions.

"It feels great" she said as she modelled the costume for her mother back in the living room "How do I look?"
"You look awesome" said her mother, almost laughing with pride "Here - there are some silver boots for your feet as well."
"You're the best mom!" replied Eve, running over and slipping on the boots, which fit her feet perfectly "How did you afford all this?"
"I've been saving up for years. That's why I've never had enough money for the house and things."

Eve smiled at her mother full of love, and she smiled back. Eve couldn't believe her mother would do something like that for her.

"Say, mom - how come the costume stops right here on my chest?" asked Eve.
Her mother laughed. "That'll make more sense when you're older, sweetheart. Powers aren't the only thing you'll be developing over the next few years, but I'm sure you will have learnt all about puberty in school already. You'll probably be absurdly hot in no time, so you might as well show it off."
"Eww" replied Eve, to the further laughter of her mother.

Experimentally, Eve decided to try some handstands and a few other gymnastic moves that she'd learnt in school in her new costume, to get used to the feeling. "So mom" she said as she tried a cartwheel, carefully not damaging anything "Do my powers have any weaknesses? Like, Superman has Kryptonite or something."
"Umm..." said her mother nervously "Well, yeah, one, but it's very rare."
"What is it?" asked Eve, now doing a spider crawl.
"Yttrium orthophosphate"
Eve stood up, looking quizzically at her mother. "Come again?" she asked.
"It's usually called Zenotime for short" replied her mother "It's a very rare kind of rock. Sometimes you can cut it into gemstones though. For some random reason that one specific compound is something you're allergic to, so you'll probably want to avoid it."
"How does it affect my powers?" asked Eve, bouncing back on to the couch in her shining new spandex costume.
"Basically your powers get weaker as you get closer to it" replied her mother again "As I said, it's very rare, and nobody else knows about it. Your father told me just before he left, actually. Anyway, Xenotime sort of black, you'll feel it when you get near it. Like a sort of overall weakening feeling."

Eve's ears perked up. "Why did my father have to go away?"
Her mother sighed. "Other aliens didn't approve of the relationship. They didn't know I was pregnant though. He put me back to earth, sailed away in his starship, and I never saw or heard of him again."
"Oh" said Eve, fidgeting. She wasn't sure why she felt like moving around so much.

"Well..." said her mother "I think it's just about time that I made dinner. After that, I think we should get started with your training!"
"Training?"

122111.content:
Eve went back to the bathroom to check herself out while her mother cooked up some dinner. She was sort of hungry after a really exciting day. When she got to the bathroom, she found that her mother wasn't lying - her appearance had changed again ever so slightly. She definitely looked a lot better now than she had before. She did a quick twirl to see how her costume looked from all sides and was suitably impressed. Of course she was extremely excited for school tomorrow.

A little bored, Eve decided to see if she could use her super hearing to tune in to the radio again. With a little concentration, she soon managed to find one of the local news stations.

"Chaos in the streets of the capital right now as reports are flooding in that the president has been assassinated. Authorities are urging civilians not to panic and to remain calm. We are yet to receive official confirmation of the president's condition but it is believed at least four shots were fired at point blank range while the president was apparently alone in his office. Officials were, however, able to rule out to us suicide as a possibility. No group has as yet claimed responsibility, and it is not believed there was prior warning of the attack at this stage. As investigations continue authorities are warning people against nonessential travel as roads have been full ever since the story first broke..."

"Oh shit" whispered Eve to herself. She'd forgotten that being a hero and all would actually require her to be brave. The president was shot? He was the most guarded person in the world. If that could happen to him then... what could happen to her? For a moment, it seemed almost too risky a profession, even if she did develop practically unlimited powers eventually.

Straining her eyes, she decided to look at the capital to see if she could find where the president was killed. This took a lot of effort. Her eyes were quite painful when she finally did manage to focus on the room, but what was more painful was the shock. There was the president, surrounded by doctors and other medical staff, and around that were a bunch of secret service security guards carrying heavy weapons. She listened in and heard them say various medical words to each other that she didn't understand. The president was now in the foyer of his house, but from the trail of blood it looked like he had been moved there. Eve followed the trail to the president's office. She also looked around and saw an ambulance approaching.

Just then, she suddenly saw something. It was a young man dressed in dark clothes, walking away from the direction of the scene and carrying a handily concealed gun. Eve looked inside the barrel and noted that the gun was loaded, but still looked hot, as if it had been fired recently...

"That's got to be the killer" she whispered to herself again. She couldn't believe it, but it slowly dawned on her what her powers could do to help people. Suddenly all her lack of courage went right out of the window and she went down to her mother, determined.

"Mom! The president's been shot. I heard it on the radio!"
"Oh" came her mother's reply, not as surprised as Eve would have thought "Yeah, the crime rate is pretty bad."
"Mom, I have to go to the capital immediately! I know who killed him!"
"Do you really know who killed him, or did you just see somebody with a gun?"

Eve stopped. "How did you know?"
Her mother smiled in response. "You've been acting a bit impulsive today, so I just figured it out. You can't just use your powers to accuse just anybody of anything. You have to be a bit smarter about it. This is going to be an important lesson, ok? Don't assume that somebody is guilty. Look at all the evidence, and consider all the options. We're not going to the capital until your powers are a little more developed."
Eve sighed but understood. Her mother was right, as usual.
"In my opinion" continued her mother "It was probably one of the secret service, and he might have been chasing the killer himself. For all you know anyway. Perhaps reporting him would make things even worse. You're a superhero now, Eve. You have to take all of that into consideration. Focus."

Once again, Eve sighed and strained her eyes in the direction of the capital, hoping to get a more holistic picture of the situation. Her mother snapped her back to attention by gently touching her shoulder.
"But don't focus right now, ok?" she said with a smile "Right now dinner's ready."

Eve went to the dining room to find a plate with three or four times her usual portion size sitting on a plate. "Mom, you know I don't eat that much" she said.
"For the next little while, you'll want to" replied her mother "In fact I'm sorry I couldn't afford more food for you. Developing powers takes a lot of energy, so you'll need to fuel up properly."
"But won't I get... sort of... fat?"
"Absolutely not. Your metabolism isn't like a normal human's. It's impossible for you to get fat."

Eve smiled as she dug in. She was quite hungry after all.

===

"Was the mission a success?" asked the secretary on her encrypted secret phone.
"Indeed" came the agent's voice over the secure connection "The president is dead."
"Then we can begin phase two" replied the secretary "You know what to do?"
"Of course I do" replied the agent, as the line crackled before going dead.

===

When Eve was finished eating the feast she found that her mother had once again been right - she had really been that hungry.

"You ready to practice your powers?" asked her mom.
"Of course I am" replied Eve happily "What are we going to work on?"
"Well... you can look through things and see things far away, but you can't see something you're not looking at, right? Like, you can't see behind you yet without turning your head?"

Eve tried it. She found that she could see a little further to the side than before, as she was looking through her own head, but without moving her head she definitely couldn't see all the way around.

"Let's work on that then" continued her mother "You should eventually be able to see in all directions at the same time - even see around corners and things - but that'll take a fair amount of practice. It's called omnivision."
"And these powers will really develop faster if I practice them?" asked Eve.
"Yes" replied her mother "So it's good you've been curious enough to practice them a lot on your own. I want you to keep watching me, ok? Don't turn your head but see if you can keep following me as I go around you."

Her mother stood up and started pacing around. After a moment, she went out of Eve's vision. "Wait, stop" said Eve "I can't see you any more there, mom"
"Try it" replied her mother "Don't try to move your eyeballs either, just see if you can see me. It might help you to concentrate if you close your eyes, actually."

Eve did as her mother instructed and closed her eyes, avoiding the strong temptation to look through her eyelids with her powers. She strained her mind, trying not just to imagine her mother standing there, but to actually see her without using her eyes at all. "Mom, I... I can't do it" she said "I don't think I have this power yet."
"That's fine" said her mother encouragingly "Just keep trying. It's good for you."

Eve kept focusing harder and harder. She tried clearing her head a little bit, putting all her effort towards this. Then, slowly, a blurry shadowy image of her mother began to form in her mind. She focused as hard as she could, trying to make that image as clear as possible before... suddenly it was gone. In frustration, Eve banged her fists down on the table.

Immediately there was a loud noise and the table turned to sawdust, breaking plates and shattering cutlery across the floor. The very ground seemed to move a little. Some big shards of broken glass hit Eve's leg, but Eve barely even felt it.

"What just happened?" asked Eve, looking around.
"Careful" warned Eve's mother "You were building up a lot of power there, trying to get it to work, then you let it all out in anger on that table. Anger is a quick way to release your power, but it's very dangerous and unpredictable. Rarely does it do what you want it to. Never get angry or frustrated, especially when you're training, ok sweetheart?"
Eve looked down. "I'm sorry mom" she sobbed.
"It's ok, I understand how hard it is" replied her mother "But you've got to learn a little self-control. Just focus on the task. Don't let yourself get frustrated when you fail."
"Yes mom. I really didn't mean it."

Eve's mother hugged her for a moment, before gently kissing her forehead. "Let's try this again" whispered her mother. Eve smiled and closed her eyes.

This time Eve was more relaxed - she almost felt more ready. Again it hurt her mind a bit but she was more used to the feeling by now. She assumed it was related to experiencing the powers for the first time. Once again, with a lot of effort, the blurry figure of her mother slowly came into view.

"I'm... doing it... mom" she gasped as she concentrated as hard as she could. The image cleared more and more until eventually, Eve could see her mother as clearly as if she was looking right at her.

"How many fingers am I holding up?" asked Eve's mother.
"Three... now two... now five" replied Eve proudly as Eve's mother paced around and tried holding up the fingers in different places. Slowly Eve was starting to be able to see not just her mother, but everything else around her as well, in every direction, just like her mother had said.
122111.title: Eve's mother trains her

choices: Eve makes it to school without incident
1221111.content:
"Now see if you can combine your powers" Eve's mother said a little excitedly "Try to use your omnivision and focus through the wall behind you."
Her mother went around to the other room and held up four fingers. This proved tricky, but eventually she managed to see this as well.

"Well done!" called her mother, walking back into the dining area "I'm so proud of you! You can open your eyes now."
Eve smiled and opened her eyes, surprised at how much more she could see now. It was like she was able to look in every direction at the same time with much less effort when she had her eyes open.

"Wow, that was amazing!" she said "Sorry about the table, though, mom."
"That's ok, it's nothing to get worked up about" replied her mother "I'll handle it... somehow... Anyway, you did great."
"Thanks mom" smiled Eve "Is every training going to be this good? Am I going to get a new power with each training or something?"
"Well... no" answered her mother "This one was quite closely related to a different power you'd already developed naturally. Most of the time it'll be best just to practice the powers that you already have and to combine them in new ways. Also, I think you still have a lot to learn about the mental side of being a superhero, also with the law and such."
"I'm glad I have you to teach me" said Eve, hugging her mother softly.

"And now... I think" announced her mother "It's time for bed, my little hero."
"What!? But I'm not tired!"
"I know you've had a very exciting day, but every young hero needs their rest. Go on, get changed into your pyjamas, brush your teeth, and then I'll come and turn the lights off for you."

Eve pouted, then sighed and did as she was told. Behind her as she left, she noticed her mother smile and wink at her again, before blowing her a kiss. With her super hearing she could just hear her say a faint "I love you" as well.

When she reached her room, Eve removed her boots and costume, enjoying the feeling of the tight spandex material coming off her skin. Her pyjamas, by contrast, seemed like giant sacks in that they were far more loose fitting and somewhat less comfortable to wear. It was almost like she wasn't a superhero any more, and had transformed back into a little girl again.

Next she went to the bathroom. Opening her mouth she was greeted with two perfect rows of gleaming white teeth, far better than she had ever seen them look. Although she had teeth now to make any dentist jealous, she decided to listen to her mother's wishes anyway and brushed them thoroughly, making various superhero poses in the mirror as she did. After washing her face really quickly she sauntered back to her room, jumped into her cosy old bed (hearing it creak loudly as she hit it) and called her mother over.

"Sweet dreams, sweetheart."
"Thanks mom. Good night."

Her mother turned the light off and left. Suddenly, Eve's eyes adjusted to the darkness. She was impressed with both how quickly it happened, and how she could instantly see everything as clearly as if it was day, even in the dark.

The temptation to play a little more with her powers grew stronger as she lay there. She began to wonder if she could practice her omnivision a little more to look around at everything as her mother had described. Closing her eyes again, she started trying to look at herself as though she was standing above herself. Trying to "see" from a different vantage point was again not the easiest thing but Eve kept straining and focusing on it. After a massive effort and no success, however, Eve sighed, letting her frustrations go quietly, and drifted off to sleep.

===

The following morning, Eve's first thought was that she must have grown overnight, because the ceiling was much closer. Suddenly realizing that her bed was no longer under her, however, she squealed with excitement.

"Mom! Mom! Look! I'm levitating!" she called.
"That's nice dear" called back her mother "Come down for breakfast or you'll be late for school."

Eve was in no rush, however. She started practicing as much as she could. She immediately tried floating just a little higher - it was slow, and really hard, but she managed to do it. Then she practiced lowering herself towards the ground, standing up proudly as her feet softly hit the bed. She did this a couple of times, trying to go up or down even faster each time she did. She found letting herself fall to be a great way to get down quickly but somehow she innately knew that with a bit of practice she could get down even faster.

"Eve, are you practicing your new power instead of getting ready again?" called her mother.
"Sorry mom!"

Eve fell down, using her levitation power to soften the impact, and made for the bathroom. Here she undressed and had a quick shower, after which she dried herself off quickly and went back to her room's drawer. She was just about to change into some casual clothes when she saw her shining new superhero costume beside it. Already Eve was feeling strange not wearing it.

"Mom?" she called out "Can I wear my new costume to school?"
"You can wear it wherever you like, sweetie. It's up to you! The material won't get dirty no matter how much you wear it, so it's fine"

Jumping in the air for joy, Eve used her levitation power to allow herself to jump extra high and high-five the ceiling. "Thanks mom" she shouted as she put it back on. Strangely enough it felt great to her, like she was now a true superhero again. When her soft hero boots were at last fitted on her feet, she ran to the kitchen to find her mother had erected a new, makeshift table out of spare plywood in the garage.

"Sorry again about the table" sighed Eve, remembering how she had destroyed it in a fit of rage.
"It's fine, really" replied her mother, bringing a giant stack of pancakes to the table "Eat up!"
"I don't think I'm ever going to get used to eating this much."
"There's extra cereal and bread in the cupboard if you like"

Eve ate up, and to her own surprise, was still hungry enough afterwards to chow through two bowls of cereal from the cupboard.

"Alright, Eve, brush your teeth, I'll pack your bag for you, you've got to get a move on or you'll miss the bus."
"But mom, my teeth look great! See?"
Eve opened her mouth, suitably impressing her mother. "Wow Eve, you have been brushing. Now hurry up and brush them again."
Not wanting to disappoint her mother, Eve went off to the bathroom and brushed her teeth quickly, using her super vision to watch her mother pack her bag as she did.

"Now you be careful at school" warned her mother "Pay attention to the teacher and don't get sidetracked. Avoid showing off or just using your powers too much. And don't get too angry or frustrated about it either. I know you'll really want to use your powers as much as you can but you need to learn that self-control. Got it?"
"No problem!" replied Eve after spitting out the toothpaste.

Moments later, Eve was at the door, kissing her mom goodbye. "I love you so much" whispered her mother.
"I love you too. Oh - hang on - would you like to see my levitation power?"
Her mother smiled. "Sure, but make it quick. The bus will be at the stop any moment now."

Trying to do it as fast as possible, Eve stepped outside and levitated up into the air, going a little higher than the roof of the house, before levitating back down as quickly as she could without using gravity.

"Impressive" said her mother "I can't wait to hear how today goes. See you after school!"
"Goodbye!" called Eve as she hurried off towards the bus stop.
1221111.title: Eve discovers more powers in the night

choices: Eve sneaks out of school to train her powers
12211111.content:
Eve waited alone at the bus stop as usual, in her sweet white and silver superhero costume. Though she didn't have to wait long, she still decided to use it as a chance to practice her powers. Any little moment alone, she thought, should be useful.

Once again she concentrated on trying to look at herself from the vantage point of across the street. Rather like the first time she had experienced her omnivision, a somewhat blurry picture actually began to form in her mind after some minutes of tough concentration, before she was jolted to attention by the sound of the bus driver stopping.

"That's some fine costume you have on" said the driver, eyeing her up "You're looking good."
"Thanks" replied Eve, climbing onboard.

Just as she went towards the back of the bus where Jessica and Sophie were, a boy from her class, Percy, stood up and blocked her path. Percy was generally known as a meanie and a bully who often used intimidation to get what he wanted.

"Well well well, looks like it's now official" said Percy, as he and the rest of the bus took a look at Eve's new figure "You're a freak."
"I'm a superhero now" said Eve coldly "Get out of my way, Percy."
"What are you gonna do, freak? You're nothing but a delusional weirdo. What kind of powers do you even have?"
Eve shrugged. "So far, I levitate, hear all, and see all. And maybe some other powers I haven't discovered yet."

At this there was a general murmur of skepticism on the bus, so Eve levitated up in the air to prove her point. Everyone was stunned.

"That's all you've got, freak?" asked Percy "What a faker you are, even wearing that lame stupid costume on. Who are you even trying to fool? It's not like you have a secret identity with that huge E written on the front. You should just go back to your home planet and leave us alone, weirdo."
"You're probably just jealous" countered Eve.
"Why would I be jealous of a loser like you?" threw in Percy.
"Because I'm part alien with more power than you can ever dream of, maybe?" said Eve. As soon as she said it, the bus went silent with shock. Eve drew a sharp breath and held her lips, immediately regretting her choice of words. "I'm sorry" she said quickly "I didn't mean to suggest that I'm better than you, I just..."
"You're not better" interjected Percy "You're not like any of us here. You're not normal, and you're not wanted. You're a freak and nothing more. You don't belong in our school, or in our world. In fact, you don't belong at all. I for one - am pretty proud to be a human. A full-blooded, normal human. And my power is something you'll never have - the power of belonging. Though I suppose some outcast retarded freak like you wouldn't understand that."
"Hey, you kids sit down back there!" yelled the bus driver before Eve could respond.

Percy sat back down on his seat, smirking at Eve. It took a lot of self control not to get angry and punch Percy right there and then, but Eve remembered her mother's words. Still, angry though it made Eve, it did hurt. She went to the back of the bus somewhat more down and dejected.

"I'm really sorry!" said Jessica as Eve sat down beside her "I was just telling Sophie about your powers, and then soon enough everyone wanted to hear about them. Percy just went too far. He's probably just insecure - don't worry about him. I didn't know about the suit though. That's pretty cool!"
"Thanks" replied Eve, looking at her suit a little more self consciously "It does look a bit over the top though"
"I think it looks amazing" chimed in Sophie "Even better than this shirt we got you, though I suppose you've seen it already."

The sight of Sophie holding up the "World's Best Friend" shirt lifted Eve's spirits somewhat.
"Try it on" said Sophie "I wanna see if it fits."
Eve shrugged and pulled on the shirt over the top of her spandex. "It fits perfectly" she said "Though I think I'll be wearing this costume most of the time from now on."
"You can keep it for if you ever need a secret identity" teased Sophie.
"Yeah" added Jessica "Or just to remind you that we'll all always be here for each other - no matter what happens."

Eve smiled, and took a moment to look into everyone's school bags, testing out her power as much as she could. While she didn't feel confident practicing to develop a new power when she was surrounded by people, it was still interesting enough. She also noted her mother had given her over a hundred dollars in lunch money, which caused her to chuckle softly to herself. She then took to reading one of the books in another kid's bag before the bus stopped at the school.

"See you all this afternoon!" called the driver cheerily.
"Best friend hug!" said Jessica, and the three girls hugged each other once again before getting off.
12211111.title: Something happens on the bus

122111111.content:
As Eve crossed the school courtyard to get to her class, she passed some kids who had managed to get their basketball stuck on the school roof. Sensing the first opportunity to use her powers to help people, Eve levitated up and tossed the ball down to the younger students below. "Thanks Eve!" called a small boy, running back to play ball with his friends. Eve glided back down towards the ground, smiling.

As she continued on to her class, she listened in to conversations happening around the school. Using her omnivision she even saw and heard the principal talk to the teachers about their "special responsibilities" or something now that a young supergirl was in their midst. This time, however, she was a little more careful not to become too focused on the meeting. Keeping tabs of both what was happening directly in front of her and in the staff room some distance away was the kind of mental juggling that Eve wasn't used to, but it was also the sort of thing she figured she should slowly figure out.

Just then, she realized two 12-year-olds kids were going smoking around the back of the toilet block. Again wanting to make a good impression as a hero, she raced off to where they were, levitating on to the roof of the block, and then floating down on the other side where they were. The two girls back there ran away as fast as they could as soon as they saw her without saying a word, leaving their cigarette packets behind.

Eve sighed and went on, but then heard that two students were getting angry at each other in another class nearby. One of them, she realized, was holding a pair of scissors. Again racing off, she made it into the classroom pretty quickly, bursting dramatically through the door.
"Eve?" asked Jessica "What are you doing in my class?"
"Sorry Jessie" replied Eve with a smile to her friend, before turning to the arguing students "But you two should know better. Don't brandish scissors when you're having a big argument. Sort it out like grown-ups. Remember - scissors are basically like two knives, so be very careful with them!"
Both students lowered their heads in shame. "Yes Eve" they both said in unison.

Eve left the class happy with how much good she had done. It caused a buzz deep inside her, that made her feel a lot better about herself as well, and in a strange sort of way, made her feel more powerful. In fact, she realized, it was exactly what she needed after Percy's mean remarks that morning. Then, however, she remembered her mother's words, cautioning her about using or practicing her powers at school. She supposed that she should probably get to class then anyway, and hoped she hadn't come across as too much of a freak or jerk. The teachers could sort out things from now on, she guessed.

Eve got to class just before the bell rang. A boy who sat across from her desk approached her. Eve recognized him as Jack, a sort of nerdy kid who was usually very shy and didn't talk much.
"Hey, umm, Eve" he gulped, shaking heavily "I think you're really pretty - I mean, err - can I get an interview with you for the school paper after school by any chance? I know you're really beautiful - I mean busy, sorry - but umm, it would really help me and maybe get your name out there a bit so... please?"
Eve smiled. "Thanks, but I've got some training to do after school."
"Oh - uhmmm - ok, that's fine" replied Jack a little sadly "I'll see you around then... maybe another time, right?"
"Sure, another time would be great" said Eve as she continued to her desk, causing Jack to almost faint.

"Well students" said the teacher, Mr Andrews "It's your last week in this class. Next year will be your final year of middle school, so I hope you're ready! We've got a lot of fun learning still to go, so don't get sidetracked!"
Just then Mr Andrews looked around the room and noticed that only Eve was looking at him. Everyone else was looking at Eve.
"OK, I know that Eve's a good looking young lady" he said "And I know that she has super powers now too, but it doesn't matter. I'm still the teacher, and everyone still has to pay attention to me. Anyone caught spending all lesson just drooling over Eve will be put on detention. Clear?"
This talk got the class back to attention. "Yes mister Andrews" they all said.

"Alright team, today we're starting off with some light maths" said Mr Andrews, to the general disappointment of his students "Specifically, long division. So how about we refresh our brains on how to do it by working through exercises five point two, three and four in your books. You can come to me if you need any help, but this should take you through to the end of the hour."

Eve groaned too, not failing to notice everyone else stealing glances as her as she got out her exercise books. She didn't mind the attention, of course, but it looked like the class next door was having a much more fun lesson. Indeed, Eve soon came to the realization that she could learn from every class in the school at the same time with her powers, but remembering her mother again, she decided against it.

Looking at the problems in her exercise book, however, Eve was confused. The problems were easy. She wasn't usually good at maths but the answers just seemed to be right there in front of her. She didn't even need to consciously calculate, it was just automatic. Cautiously, she began writing down the answers in her workbook. She soon noticed Jack copying off her but she didn't mind. Indeed, everyone else in the class was having real trouble with some of the questions. One girl at the back was secretly using a calculator, while a boy was whispering to his friend about how much of a nerd Eve was. Still, Eve didn't mind at this point, knowing better than to get angry or frustrated after what happened to her table the previous night.

===

"As the president is now incapacitated, it is with a heavy heart that I assume the office of the president for the time being. The country faces broad challenges and many threats at this time, particularly from crime. Therefore in the coming weeks I shall make maintaining law and order my top priority, until a new election is held - for which, I might add, I am announcing my candidacy right now. These law and order measures may be extreme, but remember - we cannot trust anyone at this time, even those within our own government."

"Strong words there from vice president Mitt Ghenease, a former long-serving police minister who was selected by the president to be the new vice president shortly before the president's assassination, in what some are calling an extremely happy coincidence, given Mitt's known tough stance on organized crime. The announcement will be welcomed by mayors around the country, as crime statistics are at their highest since records began..."

===

"Mr Andrews? May I be excused? I need to go to the bathroom" said Eve.

Mr Andrews looked up from his desk, where by now over half the class had lined up to get help with various problems. "How much have you finished?" he asked.
"I've done every problem in the book, marked them myself, and then used my super-vision to do every problem in next year's workbook too" she replied "It's all pretty easy so far. I'm just marking the rest of my problems from new year, but I'm yet to get any wrong."
Mr Andrews adjusted his glasses. "You're not just using your powers to look at the answers pages, are you?"
"No sir. Really."
"Alright then, Eve. Make it quick."

Smiling to herself at her newfound super intellect, Eve left the class to go to the bathroom. There, she immediately saw a boy with a camera trying to hide from her.
"Seriously Damon?" asked Eve, her hands on her hips "Go back to your class."
Damon rushed off, extremely embarrassed.

Eve went into one of the stalls, just as she realized how inconvenient it is to go to the toilet wearing a spandex costume. She eventually took it mostly off, which left her feeling slightly exposed and less like a super hero. When she was done, she redressed and washed her hands, noticing with approval that her reflection seemed ever so slightly cuter than it did even before school that morning, although she had somewhat guessed that from the reactions of her classmates. It was as though she was inching towards physical perfection extremely slowly, but steadily. She also felt like she actually was slightly taller than she had been the day before, but not by much.

Just in that moment, Eve realized that the corner store down the street was being robbed. She could clearly hear the shouts of the robbers and see the gun being pointed. Realizing she had to make a quick decision, she felt an urgent need to help out and use her powers, but she also clearly remembered the words of warning from her mother.
122111111.title: Eve discovers super intelligence

1221111111.content:
Eve didn't really know why, but before she knew it she was already running out of the school, going after the robbers in the corner store, covering the distance quickly as she had before soccer practice the day before, and again, surprising herself at how she didn't seem to get tired. As she went, she practiced switching rapidly between looking ahead of her, and watching what was going on. She found it easier if she focused her listening and where she looked to the same place, but she also checked in one the police scanner, noticing that the cops apparently weren't aware of what was happening yet. The closest cop car she could see was many blocks away, and that officer was apparently on break, drinking coffee and eating a donut.

As the two robbers were holding the store owner at gunpoint and emptying his till, Eve quickly went around the back of the store, levitating slightly with each step so as to be as quiet as possible. She levitated up to the back window, opened it quietly, and snuck inside without being seen. Quickly she descended, keeping a soft landing to avoid making a noise, and hid behind several shelves of goods. The window, however, did make a noise as it closed again, shutting with a loud clang.

Immediately one of the robbers pointed his gun in the direction of the window.
"Let it go" said the other robber, snatching more and more cash out of the register "It's probably just the wind."
"Well hurry up" replied the other one "You've been fingering that money for a couple of minutes now - we've got to get a move on."

Eve took a moment to use her super vision to look beyond the dark balaclavas and clothes of the robbers and see they were both middle aged men. She took her time to get a good description in case she needed it, then crept around to hide near the entranceway.

"Alright, I've got the loot. Let's get out of here."
With that the two robbers made for the front door. Acting completely on gut instinct, Eve jumped out in their way, her costume seemingly flashing brightly as she did so. As both robbers saw the young, pretty but determined looking girl in front of them, they couldn't help but laugh a little, but they half-heartedly pointed their guns at her.
"Who do you think you are? Some kind of superhero?"
"Yeah, what kind of a costume is that, freak?"

For a moment, Eve felt that the robber's words echoed the words of the bully Percy on the bus. A kind of annoyance flashed over her at how easily others were judging her, but she quickly remembered her mother's warning, and also above all, her friends. In a way it made her appreciate them more because she knew they'd remain friends no matter what happened.

"You want to know who I am?" asked Eve "I'm Eve, the town's newest superhero. Drop the guns and hand over the money, or I'll tell the cops."
"Wow, I'm so scared" laughed one of the robbers "A little girl's going to call her mommy on me. Is that really the best you've got."

Eve sighed and performed a quick kung fu move to disarm both robbers and take their guns, pointing them at them. The robbers were stunned, and Eve was a little surprised too. She didn't really know how she'd learnt that, but assumed that it had probably just come with her super intelligence. Either way, it was a useful trick. One of the two robbers immediately threw his hands up in the air, full of fear. The other one, who had the money and was also the one who'd insulted Eve just as Percy had, however, was unmoved.

"You seriously want to shoot me? Come on, little girl" he teased "Shoot me. You're not just a freak, you're a little girl with no guts. Now let me past before I knock you out."

Once again the robber's comment made Eve quite angry, but she ignored the feeling as much as she could. "You'd better shut your mouth... right... now" she warned, levitating up so she was eye level with the robber, and not showing the slightest hint of fear.

The effect was somewhat unexpected, as both robbers backed away slowly, mouths agape. "Woah... you can fly?"
"Well, actually technically I can only levita... wait, I mean, yes. Yes. I can fly. And I can also do all sorts of other cool things."
"Oh, so you're a real superhero? I'm sorry, I thought you were just faking. Because if you were, you know, you know we'd have to teach you a lesson."
This made Eve angry enough that she couldn't stop herself from cocking the gun. "Don't you dare talk about hurting anyone again. Trust me, you do not want to see what I can do when I get annoyed" she said, thinking of the solid table she had particalized the night before.
"Ok, ok, take it easy."

Once again, the overwhelming rush returned to her. Eve felt like this was what she was meant to do - what she was born to do. And she loved it.

In the background, the store owner had already taken to calling the police. Using her vision powers, Eve could tell that two cop cars were on their way and would arrive very shortly. Smiling to herself, Eve surrendered both guns to the store owner.

"Make sure these two low-lives don't run away" she said lightly "I have to go and get back to school"
"How can I ever repay you?" asked the store owner.
"Oh, no charge" she smiled "Maybe one day you can get me a discount on some food here or something though - I'm starved."
"I won't forget it" said the store owner, as he and Eve mutually waved goodbye.

Eve smiled to herself as she ran back to the class. After all those heroics, she felt even more powerful than before. Like something big was building up inside her. Still, she also felt a kind of shame at having skipped a bit of class, and not listened to her mother. She knew that she could have been killed quite easily, and in retrospect, she couldn't believe what she had just done. In fact she wasn't sure where the sudden courage had come from, since usually Eve could be quite squeamish. She also remotely kept an eye on the situation in the corner store, but it seemed her judgment had been right, and the store owner was handling things quite well with the robbers disarmed and the police on their way.

"Sorry I took so long" she said as she came back to the room, noting that she had been gone for over fourty-five minutes.
"I hope you used the time constructively" said Mr Andrews, as Eve noticed the line to his desk was no shorter. Eve settled back down to her desk with a smile, and was about to start where she had left off, before she quickly raised her hand, interrupting Mr Andrews again.

"Hey Mr Andrews, can I do some problems from that textbook you have in the back room? They look a bit harder so... I just figured I want to exercise my brain a bit more." said Eve, eager to practice her super intelligence power.
"Eve, those are university level problems" replied Mr Andrews.
"Yeah, I can tell" said Eve, happily "Still, they all look easy enough to me."
Mr Andrews shrugged. "Fine. Do you want me to get it for you."
Eve activated her super vision. "Actually, sir, I can read it well enough from here..."

12211111111.content:
Lunch came quickly enough, and Eve soon found herself holding up the whole school cafeteria with her giant order. In fact she didn't even spend all the money her mother had given her to be polite to the other students, but somehow she knew she would still be hungry when she'd eaten it all. Her mother was really right about superpower development giving you a super appetite.

As she waited, a boy called Felix walked up to her. Felix was known around the school for being quite popular and having a lot of friends, and a trail of his friends was following him around even now.
"Hey Eve" he said "I just wanted to say, I really admire you, and your costume is awesome and all that, so ummm... do you want to hang out together at some point? Maybe after school?"
"Sorry" replied Eve "But first I have to train. If I ever don't train, then I'm doing an interview with Jack. And I also need to hang out with my best friends, Jessica and Sophie."
"Oh" said Felix, quite dejected "Well, ummm... sorry for the interruption. I'll see you soon."

At last her order was finished, and Eve carried a small mountain of food to an outside picnic table where her best friends were waiting for her, who both looked at her awkwardly.
"Won't that make you... fat?" asked Sophie.
"I thought that at first too" replied Eve "But apparently it doesn't work that way for superheros."
Sophie shrugged and finished eating her designer club sandwich.
"So how are you feeling?" asked Jessica "Any new powers? I hope that Percy didn't get you down too much on the bus this morning."
Eve laughed, having just quickly gulped down a large mouthful of food. "I thought you were the one telling me not to worry! But I'm doing great, honestly. In fact I've been feeling really good inside ever since I saved the corner store down the road from two armed robbers this morning."
"You did that?" asked Sophie, impressed "I would have been too scared."
"Yeah, it's strange" replied Eve "This sudden rush of courage just came over me - I just felt like I needed to help, so I did. Like my instinct was just telling me what to do."

"Hey, is this seat free?" asked Peter, a boy from Jessica's class.
"Do you actually want to sit with us, or are you just trying to score a date with me?" asked Eve.
"Just a date, to be honest..."
"Well then, maybe some other time"

"I've still been asked out by more boys today" bragged Sophie.
"It's not a competition" reminded Jessica "So you don't have any new powers now, Eve?"
"Well, I'm smarter than I used to be" said Eve "Like, I suddenly found all the problems in my maths book extremely easy. I even found university level maths extremely easy. It all just kind of intuitively makes sense to me now."
"Great!" said Jessica "You should tutor me! I'm useless at maths."
"Usually I am too" giggled Eve, taking another huge mouthful.

Some time passed while Eve finished the rest of her gigantic meal, and the three girls finished their chat, talking about school, and then moving on to celebrity crushes. A few times Eve was tempted to fight bad things that she sensed were happening around the school and the city, but for now she felt she'd had her fix - not to mention that she didn't want to just abandon her friends.

"Hey Eve, have your arms always been that huge?" observed Jessica.
Eve looked at her arms, which were suddenly quite muscular. Indeed, when she levitated up, she and everyone else saw that her whole body had somehow become ripped with muscle - toned and athletic all over, and better than any young gymnast her age, while maintaining her soft and cute look. Eve started moving around, examining herself all over. In addition, she felt like she'd grown slightly taller again, and though she was still far from the tallest in the class, it was still noticeable given that only 24 hours ago, Eve didn't know about any powers at all.
"Woah - you are huge" wooed Jessica.
"What kind of steroids were in all that food?" asked Sophie "It's like half of it just transformed straight into muscle."
"Yeah, and ummm - I have gym class next, so..." began Eve, levitating back down.
"Well then, you need to tell us all about it!" said Sophie cheerfully.
"Best friend hug!" declared Jessica, and the three friends did their ritual before going on their way.

As Eve went towards the school gym building, Emma, a girl from her class who was a junior cheerleader, went up to her. "Hey, Eve!" she said "Do you need togs? We're doing swimming today. I have an extra set in case you didn't bring yours."
Eve sighed. "You trying to go out with me now?"
"No no. Nothing like that" laughed Emma "I just want to help you out. Also, I want you to be the captain of our cheerleading squad."
"Captain?" asked Eve.
"Yeah. I mean, you're the center of attention everywhere you go. If you cheer, the other team will get distracted, your team will get inspired - you're just a natural at it, Eve. And you can probably do moves that none of us can. And I hear you're super smart now, so you'll know how to teach us too."
"I'll think about it" replied Eve, unsure of whether she would have the time to do it.
"Thanks" smiled Emma, holding up a small bikini "You're the best. So, umm, do you need this? You can keep them if you like - just a present in advance, in case you ever need to save me or something."

Eve smiled, and soon enough she was in the girl's changing rooms, getting into Emma's spare and revealing swimwear, showing off her beautiful and muscular body to the variously jealous and impressed girls around the changing room. Striking one or two poses for her captivated audience, she went outside to wait with her class. Immediately, all eyes were on her. The boys seemed particularly affected, eyeing up every square centimeter of skin. Only Jack managed to control himself, looking away and blushing, though Eve could see that he was clearly extremely attracted.

"Alright class!" said the gym teacher, Mr White "Today we're focusing on butterfly swimming, one of the most physically demanding styles. I want everyone to give it their all, alright? Swim as fast as you can, otherwise we'll be here all day. Everyone does one lap, and I'll tell you what you need to work on for the rest of the lesson. Remember, we're not judging anyone here. You all got it?"

The whole class nodded, and Mr White checked his clipboard. "Eve, you're up first" he announced.
Eve was quite nervous. She didn't really know why, but somehow she was as she stepped up to the diving board of the pool. In the background, somebody wolf whistled, to the annoyance of Mr White. "Just give it your best shot, Eve" he said "Fast as possible, butterfly style."

Eve drew a quick breath, and then launched herself a little harder than usual - though not nearly as hard as she was capable of - off the diving board.

Without using her levitation powers at all, Eve suddenly found herself soaring up through the sky. Her kick off the board not only shattered the board, but it caused a large sonic boom that knocked everybody off their feet and nearly emptied the pool. As Eve went up through the atmosphere, she realized with horror that her swimwear had disintegrated, leaving her naked. She managed to cover up just in time with her hands as she went past the international space station. Seconds later, she did a backflip around the moon and was plummeting back towards earth. Very briefly the earth's atmosphere burnt around her, causing her to appear like a very fast comet for a split second, although for some reason Eve wasn't hurt at all. Then finally, before Eve had much of a chance to process what was really happening, she landed in exactly the same location she took off from, went straight through the ground and continued down, leaving behind a small hole that was immediately filled in by the surrounding dirt, causing a small earthquake on the surface.

Eve kept "falling" as the rocks around her became heavier, harder and hotter. Eventually all the rock was molten and she was still falling, until the pressure became to great and she fell right into the solid core at the center of the earth. Finally she came to a stop at a point her super intelligence told her was the center of the earth.

Despite the extreme heat and pressure, Eve found the weight of the entire planet, with everything on it, to be light as a feather. She was literally now holding up the entire earth, and she wasn't even straining. Even her hair seemed easily strong enough to withstand the intense forces of the whole world. She stayed there for a moment while the reality of it dawned on her. She was strong. Impossibly strong. The laws of physics literally made what she was currently doing impossible. Nobody was going to believe this.

With a bit of gentle kicking she eventually made her way back to the surface, causing a small aftershock to the earthquake she had created. Looking around (still covering herself up) she was relieved to see that the damage she had caused had been minor, but she had left the entire class in a state of considerable shock at what had just happened.

"That was not a butterfly stroke" said Mr White sternly, going to get a hose to re-fill the pool "And put some clothes on young lady, or else you'll be in big trouble."
The rest of the class was too awe-struck by Eve's incredible physique to even giggle at that.
"Yes sir" said Eve, before running away at impossible super speeds with her newly enhanced legs.

122111111111.content:
Eve went back to the changing room to find her superhero costume was missing as well. With a quick scan around of her super vision, she realized Percy, the school's biggest bully, had her costume in the back of his bag and was laughing about it to his friends.

Eve quickly changed into Emma's usual clothes, hoping that Emma wouldn't mind as she was still swimming. She didn't want to confront Percy naked after all. As she did so, she was reminded once again of how weird she felt wearing clothes other than her costume. Somehow wearing that costume just felt right to her. In a flash, she was standing right in front of Percy, incensed.

"Well well well" said Percy "If it isn't the school's resident freak. I was wondering when you would show up, dork."
"Percy" said Eve sternly, her rage building "Give it back."
"No" replied Percy "We don't negotiate with losers like you. I told you - just go back to your home planet. Or did they not want a freak like you either? Isn't that why you were sent here? What are you gonna do to me, levitate slightly? Bring it on!"
At that, Eve lost it, and held Percy in a choke hold. Percy tried to fight out of it, but against Eve's infinitely strong arms there was literally nothing he could do. Eve started to levitate up, holding Percy by his throat some meters above the ground.
"Argh! Is this it?" sniggered Percy, still fighting "Some kind of little girl freak who wants to kill me?"

When she saw the rude yet helpless Percy, however, she couldn't bring herself to actually do something to him. Her rage rapidly coming back under control, she loosened her grip and let him down, defeated.
"That's what I thought" boasted Percy "You're too much of a 'hero'! You'd never hurt a poor guy like me. And that's why you're not getting your costume back."
"No" responded Eve "I won't hurt you."
"See?" said Percy to his friends "What did I tell you?"
"But I'm still getting my suit back" said Eve, using her super strength to wrench Percy's backpack right off his back.
"Hey! Give me back my bag, that's mine" said Percy, helplessly trying to punch Eve's super strong body but only injuring his own fists.
"Your bag?" asked Eve, pulling out her costume from inside the bag, "That's funny, because it has my stuff in it."
"I didn't mean it! I'm sorry!" he said "Give me back my bag!"

Eve shrugged and tossed the bag back to him, the force of her powerful throw sending him flying to the ground.
"Next time" said Eve, trying to control her own frustration at the bully "Next time I might not be so nice to you."

With that she ran back to the changing rooms, putting back Emma's clothes and changing back into her own costume just as gym class ended.

When school was over, Eve went back to the bus. Of course she could have run home at super speeds, but she wanted to see her friends again. As she boarded she saw Percy and some girl she didn't know nursing a large bruise on Percy's neck. She felt really bad about what she'd done to him, but moved on quickly after Percy shot her a mean, hostile glance.

"Hey Eve!" said Jessica excitedly "I heard you beat up Percy! You go girl! About time somebody showed Percy what's up!"
"I don't know" said Eve a little sadly "I feel pretty bad about it. Percy was defenseless."
"Yeah, well in my opinion, you do the crime, you probably want to get beat up by Eve" mentioned Sophie "Honestly, you can't expect us to be like the Percy fan club right now."
"It doesn't matter" added Jessica quickly "We're friends no matter what. I hope you don't get in trouble over it."
"Well I don't want to do that again" said Eve quietly.

"I heard you held up the entire Earth while in the core" said Sophie, quickly changing the subject.
"Yeah, it turns out I have unlimited strength now" she said, flexing her muscles "It made gym class a bit awkward."
"I'll bet" said Jessica, squeezing Eve's arm "I can't believe I was the first to notice these muscles. It's so great being friends with a superhero."
"Yeah, you're already better than any comic hero I know" said Sophie.
"Better than superman?" asked Eve.
"Way better" smiled Sophie "Especially because you're my friend."

Just then the bus stopped near Eve's house. "Best friend hug!" said Jessica as she always did, and the three girls hugged each other, giggling. As she always did, Eve found the spare key to her house and went inside. She sat down on the couch and decided to keep doing the training she'd been doing on her own.

Once again she concentrated on looking at herself from the vantage point of across the room. It took a moment to get in the frame of mind of working on her visual powers again, since all afternoon she'd been preoccupied with her new physical powers. Once she did, however, she found it a little easier to get back to the blurry image she achieved that morning. It took a lot of effort, but eventually, she found she was, in fact, looking at herself sitting on the couch.

Having achieved that, she then tried combining that with seeing through walls, as her mother had taught her the day before to practice combining her powers. This again took a lot of mental effort. Eve strained and she strained, but eventually she managed it just in time to see her mother pull into the garage.

"Eve? You home?" called out her mother.
"Yeah" said Eve, rushing over "You won't believe what kind of powers I got today!"
"Won't I?" replied her mother, hands on her hips "Try me."
"Super strength!" said Eve, flexing her huge arm muscles "And I'm super smart now too. Oh, and I JUST taught myself how to use my super-vision from any vantage point. I can literally see anything in the universe that I like now! It's great!"
"Nothing unbelievable there" said her mother, kissing Eve's forehead gently "Not to mention that you look great too, sweetheart. I'll bet you get the attention of all the boys with a body like that."
Eve blushed. "Well, I've been asked on a few dates."

Eve's mother smiled as she went off to the kitchen. "Good to hear you're doing some training on your own, though I'd wish you didn't do so much at school" she said "Those two robbers at the corner store definitely could have killed you."
"I know" replied Eve sadly "Wait a moment - how did you hear about that?"
"Sweetie, it was all over the news" laughed her mother "They even interviewed some bully who said you beat him up."

Eve looked up quizzically. Experimentally, she tried tuning her eyes like she did with her ears when she wanted to listen to the radio. Sure enough, she had little trouble picking up TV stations too. There was her face in her costume, all around screens across the world, captured on security camera footage from the dairy.

"I expect the paparazzi will be here soon" smiled her mother "Just don't say anything stupid while you're with the media. You don't want to get a bad reputation if you're a superhero. Rather, you should always be somebody the people look up to."
"So you're not mad at me?" asked Eve.
Eve's mother smiled. "Eve, I could never get mad at you. You're my daughter, and I love you forever. Always remember that. Now go to your room and practice your levitation. You might want to work on going up and down a little bit faster. Tonight, we'll see if you can actually go in all directions - that is, really fly."

===

"Well, agent, we may have a complication" said the secretary "It seems I was right. A superhero has emerged in the form of a young girl."
"WHAT!? How?" asked the agent "It's not possible - you must be mistaken."
"You know how meticulous I am" replied the secretary coldly "But I know exactly how to deal with her."
"You do? Ummm..."
"Don't you worry agent. Continue with the plan as normal. I will keep everything under control."

===

"Mmmm, mom, that meal was delicious" said Eve.
"I hoped you'd like it" said her mother shyly "It's hard to disguise the taste of rat poison."
Eve almost vomited. "You put WHAT in my food?"
Her mother pulled a packet of rat poison out of the cupboard. "I'm trying to train your stomach, sweetie. You should be getting immunity to all poisons, toxins, diseases and such, so this is just a kind of way of waking up your power a bit."

Eve pouted. "I wish you'd warn a little before you do something like that."
Her mother smiled back. "Sure thing. Next time, I will. Now, you want to go outside and practice some flying?"

Soon enough Eve stood outside and levitated up in the air in the evening twilight. Her practice earlier had gone well, and she could now move up and down quite quickly.
"Now, I want you to concentrate really hard, and will yourself forwards" said Eve's mother.
As she was quite used to doing by now, Eve closed her eyes and concentrated hard. To her surprise, she actually got the hang of it within a few minutes or so. She began moving forwards, albeit extremely slowly.

"Very good!" called out her mother "Now try flying a little faster!"
Eve concentrated more and more, but this seemed to be the rub. She could fly slowly no problem, but going faster was just frustratingly hard.
"Come on, you can do it!" cheered her mother "I believe in you, sweetie! Try to keep that superman pose too, it looks great!"
Eve pushed herself forward as much as her mind could muster. Eventually she managed to get up to a ground running speed, though in the air it didn't seem that fast. She also got used to holding her body in a few different positions, doing a couple of figure eights.

"Alright Eve" called her mother "You've done really well. That was impressive for your first flight. Now it's time for bed."
"Aww, but I'm not even tired!" replied Eve, flying back towards the door.
"I said it's time for bed" said her mother sternly, leading her back inside.
