1221111111111.content:
Eve walked back to her bedroom. She was about to change into her pajamas when a thought occurred to her.

"Hey mom?" she called "Can I wear my costume to bed? Please?"
"Of course you can, sweetie" called her mother back "I'm glad that you like it so much! That suit is resistant to pretty much everything, so it should be safe."
"Really?" asked Eve "So I can even swim in it?"
Her mother chucked. "Yeah. The suit even dries your skin afterwards automatically."
"You have no idea how useful that would have been to know earlier today, mom" replied Eve, to which her mother only laughed.

Following her mother's traditions, Eve then went to the bathroom to brush her perfect white teeth. She amused herself by using her super vision to watch as the toothpaste killed off individual germs on her teeth, but soon she grew tired of that and headed to bed.

"Good night Eve" smiled her mother as she came into Eve's room and tucked the young super-heroine into the covers "I hope your first full day with powers was lots of fun."
"You bet" said Eve in a pretend-tired voice.
"OK. You have a good rest" said her mother, turning out the light.

Once again, Eve's eyes adjusted immediately to the darkness. She watched as her mother went away from the room and started to search for a new table in a home-buying catalog. Satisfied that her mother would not come and check up on her, Eve scanned around the community, wondering what was going on.

The first thing she noticed was a domestic dispute down the road. A husband and wife were arguing with each other because the wife had cheated on her husband. Once again, Eve felt the same overwhelming compulsion to use her powers to calm things down. She snuck out of bed, slowly and quietly, with the hope that her mother wasn't listening to the creak that her bed made whenever she moved in it. With a quick check using her powers to see that her mother hadn't noticed anything, she quietly opened her window and jumped outside, enjoying for a moment the cool evening breeze. Then, with a minimum of effort, she ran at super speeds to the home with the dispute and pressed calmly on the doorbell.

"Who the bloody hell are you?" asked a very angry looking man, opening the door.
"Don't you watch the news?" asked Eve "I'm Eve, the newest super hero in town. You two need to stop arguing and calm down right now. You're supposed to be adults, so just settle this quietly, before somebody gets hurt."
"You can't be serious!" yelled the man "Susan! Did you call the bloody cops and tell 'em to send some kid around 'ere?"
"You know I wouldn't do things behind your back Peter!" yelled a woman's voice back.
"Stop!" yelled Eve, stamping her foot to the ground and causing the Earth to rumble. Peter mumbled something about more bloody earthquakes, but other than that it shut the two of them up.

"You two need to seriously get a grip" said Eve, flying inside and sitting down in their living room "And yes Peter, the baby inside Susan is yours, I can see his DNA. But Susan, you need to calm down too. You both have good reason to be angry, but you need to compromise and work this out before you start hurting each other. You both understand?"
"Yes Eve" they both muttered, walking into the living room and sitting down.
"And don't let me hear you still arguing after I fly away either" said Eve, as she left them to negotiate there.

Both were a little stunned at the young girl but said nothing as she flew away. Just before she closed the door, though, Peter stopped her. "Wait" he said "Thank you. Thanks for stopping by."
"Anytime" said Eve, as she flew away, feeling amazing.

Eve flew around above the neighborhood. For a while she practiced going faster, but she still couldn't top the running speed she'd reached earlier, despite much effort. Then something caught her eye. It was Jack, the young nerdy reporter from school. He was looking at an old picture of Eve in the school magazine from last year with a longing expression. Then, using a small black marker, he drew over the top of Eve's old clothes her new superhero outfit. Underneath that he wrote the caption "Eve, Protector of the Universe", cut it out, and glued it carefully to his wall, staring at it and sighing heavily.

"Jack, it's time for bed" called Jack's dad.
"But dad, I'm not tired" protested Jack.
"Jack, go to bed, now" replied his dad sternly "No more excuses. Go to the toilet, have a shower, brush your teeth, get changed, sleep."

Eve flew down to a nearby park, hiding shyly in a tree and watching as Jack finished his evening routine. Somehow she felt that after all of the invitations to date she'd received that day, his had been the most heartfelt. It was almost like she felt sorry for him, but then, she also was starting to actually like him for who he was, in a way.

Her thoughts were interrupted as she realized Peter and Susan were arguing again. Running with her powerful legs back to their place in a couple of bounds, she tapped lightly on their window to remind them that she was always listening in. Correctly guessing that it was her outside, the couple calmed down their discussion again.

She then went back to Jack's house to see that Jack's dad had just turned the lights off. Jack was lying there with a tear in his eye, quietly saying some prayers that even if Eve was too good for him, that God would still watch over Eve and protect her. Eve could hold herself back no longer, flying up to outside his window. She hesitated before knocking a little, feeling a little embarrassed that she was even secretly listening in, but eventually found the courage to do it.

Jack sat up in his bed, hearing the knock outside his window. A little confused, he drew back the curtains, only to nearly fall back with shock and delight when he saw Eve flying out there. With a little hesitation while he composed himself, he opened the window.

"Uh - hi, umm, Eve" he whispered, shaking, as Eve giggled outside "What are you doing here?"
"Oh, I'm just flying around" said Eve "I can do that now - I got a new power."
"Oh - uh - cool, yes" said Jack, getting more nervous by the second.
"I heard your prayer as I passed by" said Eve "So I thought, since you wanted to interview me, why not let you do that right now?"
Jack was breathing heavily. "Ummm... I don't really..." he began.
"It's ok to be nervous" interjected Eve "I need to practice talking to the media anyway."
"Oh, it's not that" gulped Jack "It's just, my dad..."

"Jack!" yelled his dad from the other room "Are you talking on your phone after your bedtime?"
"No dad!" called Jack back.
"You better not be!" yelled Jack's dad.
Eve giggled. "Oh, I see" she whispered, opening the window a little further to allow her to fly inside "Well..."

Very gently, still flying, she lifted the covers off of Jack's bed, leaving him lying there in his boxers, too amazed to be able to move. Flying to the cupboard Eve tossed him some clothes, and getting the hint, he rapidly tossed them on. Then, she picked him up very gently, and carefully flew out of the window with him, up into the sky, before coming down beside a romantic moonlit creek at the park.

Jack was a little flustered, his greatest fantasy having just come true. Eve giggled again.
"So" said Eve, lying down on the grass and looking up at the stars "The interview..."
"Right" said Jack, lying down beside her and trying hard not to just stare at her "Well, ummm... sorry I'm a bit nervous... is it true that you're... from another planet?"
"My father is" replied Eve "My mother's from here though."
"So you don't really know your father?"
"Yeah, until yesterday I thought he was dead. Turns out he's just in another world."
Jack sighed. "My mother died giving birth to me. I pray every night that she's in another world now, too."
"That's really sweet."
This made Jack blush deeply. "Soo... what's the story behind you punching Percy in the throat?"
Now it was Eve's turn to be embarrassed. "I didn't punch him really, I held him in a choke hold. I didn't mean it though. It was by accident. He just made me angry because he stole my costume."
"He's such a jerk. The whole school respects you now for that, you know? I mean, I liked you a lot before, but..."
"Yeah, I can tell. I got that impression. Even my best friends were glad about it."
"Jessica and Sophie are your best friends, right?"
"Yeah, we met in girl scouts and... hey, I think I need to take you back now? Your dad is walking towards your room."

A note of alarm crossed Jack's face. "I'm sorry!" he said quickly as Eve carefully picked him up and flew off "I won't tell him you came, I promise!"
"It's alright, he won't notice - we can finish the interview tomorrow" said Eve, quickly flying back into the window and tossing him on his bed, not even realizing that in her urgency she'd beaten her air speed record significantly.
Jack rapidly stripped back into his boxers while Eve rapidly tucked in the covers of his bed exactly as she had found them.
"Good night" said Eve to Jack, kissing him gently on his cheek as she flew out.
"Good night" whispered Jack, quickly closing the window and the curtains.

The instant Jack lay back down, Eve saw Jack's father opened Jack's door and look around the room. Jack crossed his fingers and clenched his eyes shut, hoping that his father wouldn't notice anything. He didn't, and soon left the room. Eve watched as Jack put his hand to his cheek where she had kissed him before going to sleep, completely overwhelmed.

Eve flew back to her room, noticing a small note had been stuck on her window frame. She looked around for where the note might have come from, but saw nobody acting suspicious in the surrounding neighborhood. The note said simply:

Meet me at 2am tomorrow, under the Interstate Bridge

- The Secretary
1221111111111.title: Eve sneaks out at night

12211111111111.content:
Eve woke up the following morning feeling a little strange. Not only was she again sleeping while levitated, but for the first time since she started getting her powers, she actually felt uncomfortable. It was an unusual sort of itch that she had across the front of her chest.

"Oh my gosh" she whispered, recalling some health class that she had once "I'm growing breasts"

Eve flipped around in the air, trying to get a good look at herself, but with no luck. Eventually she used her powers to try to look at herself, but it was no use. She tried focusing and re-focusing, but no matter what she did, she could no longer see herself. She even tried checking the heat of the air particles around her, noticing for a first time how cool it was that she could actually see heat. She hadn't realized that was a superpower before, but now that she thought about it - regardless, it was no use. It was like she was literally no longer there.

"Mom! Mom!" cried Eve, flying downstairs in a panic "Mom, can you see me?"
"Of course not, sweetie" replied her mother "You're invisible. You just gained a new power."
"I did? I mean, wow! Great! Check it out, mom, I'm invisible! Look at me!"
"I can't. That's the point of being invisible"
"So why can't you see my suit then?"
"I guess that's probably part of your power. Things you're wearing probably become invisible along with you."
"I can't believe it" said Eve while celebrating by flying around in little loops "I can't wait to show the others at school!"
"They won't be able to see you either" said her mother, not really sure where Eve was "Now become visible again and eat your breakfast."
"Sure" said Eve excitedly "How do I do that?"
"Figure it out!" exclaimed her mother "The same way you figured out how to control all your other powers."

Eve sat down invisibly and concentrated for a moment. It was an unfamiliar sort of thought, trying to change her own visibility. With a little mental strain, however, she slowly faded into view. As a test, she tried making herself invisible again. It turned out that her visibility was easier to control than most of her other powers had been, but it still took some getting used to.

Finally settling into a visible state, Eve went back upstairs and had a shower. As she took her suit off, she noticed that she'd been right - her breasts had grown slightly, for the first time, overnight. It had actually been quite a bit of growth for one night but to Eve they still looked extremely small. Still, since she was only 11, it wasn't as though she minded much. As she cleaned herself she noticed how the skin there felt at once sensitive, but also still as impossibly strong as the rest of her body.

Stepping out of the shower, she took a moment to admire her muscular, beautiful body one more time. She felt like she was even better looking now - probably beyond super-model level anyway, and quite possibly beyond what a normal human was capable of achieving, especially at her age.

Eve put her skin-tight spandex costume back on and strolled to the makeshift table of the dining area, just as her mother finished cooking her breakfast. "Any more rat poison in this, mom?" she asked.
"No" replied her mother, putting away a drum of green, bubbling liquid "Just a bit of toxic waste. Don't worry, not enough to ruin the flavor of all that french toast I made you. Hey, your breasts look a bit bigger."
"I know mom" said Eve, suddenly feeling a little embarrassed about it. They were still feeling a bit itchy as well.
"Just so long as you don't go flying out at night for dates" laughed her mother.
"Right" Eve said in between chews of her massive breakfast.
"So - I got a call from the school principal this morning."
Eve's heart sank. She hoped that she wouldn't be expelled.
"First of all, he wants to congratulate you for all the times that you saved the day yesterday. Especially when you saved his day by beating up some kid called Percy. Apparently he says Percy was a total jerk who needed to be taught a lesson."
Eve almost spat out her food. "For the last time, I didn't hit him! I didn't even mean to do anything to him, he just stole my suit!"
Her mother laughed. "The real reason he called me though, was to remove you from the class."

"What?" asked Eve, shocked "They're expelling me?"
"No. They say you're a model student, but you're too good for their lessons. By law you have to attend school, but if you're over-achieving, there's no law on what you can study there."
"So - what does this mean for me?"
"They'll put you in a spare room, by yourself, so you can get a college degree. We've enrolled you in a bunch of papers already - things pertinent to your superhero life, like law and ethics."
"So - I won't get to sit with my classmates?"
"You'll still see them on the bus and at breaks. But you won't sit with them in class, no. Apparently the school board thinks you might be a distraction."

Eve sighed, accepting it. She could certainly understand why other parents might have felt that way, but she knew that she would miss her classmates.

"And keep your back straight" added her mother "I know you want to hide your developing breasts a bit, but good back posture is much more important."
Eve huffed, turning invisible as she did so, which made her mother laugh.

A short time later Eve was flying to the school bus stop. Seeing the bus was still some distance away, she turned invisible and practiced flying at higher speeds. It was still difficult, but slowly she was starting to get the hang of speeding up and slowing down. Shortly before the bus arrived she flew down and made herself visible at the bus stop again.

"Welcome back, freak" said Percy, now wearing a neck brace, as she boarded "I didn't think you'd have the guts to show your pretty face around here again."
"Shut up Percy" commanded Eve, trying to gently push past him, but Percy didn't take the hint and kept stopping her from going to see her friends nearer to the back of the bus.
"No, you shut up" countered Percy "You're a loser, not wanted on your home planet, or here. You don't belong anywhere. And you have the audacity to beat up a kid like me? You should have gone away a long time ago."
Once again all eyes were on Eve. "Fine" she said "I'll go away." And with that, she turned invisible.

Percy was stunned. It wasn't quite what he'd expected. "Is she gone?" asked some kid in the back.
"Yeah" said Eve, turning visible again "And now I'm back. Now get back into your seat before I put you there, Percy."
Percy stared at her with venom in his eyes. Eve tried again, "Look, I did what you said, I went away. Now that I'm back, it's your turn to move out of the way so I can sit with my friends."
With a lot of visible reluctance, Percy sat back down. "It's not over" he whispered to her "I'll get you back for all this! One day, I swear I'll get you back..."

Eve shrugged and re-joined Sophie and Jessica in the spot where the three friends usually sat.
"Hey Eve" said Sophie "Cool power. You just turned invisible, right?"
"Yeah" said Eve "And I can fly properly now too. And I've eaten about a ton of toxic waste and rat poison but don't feel sick in the slightest."
"Not bad" said Sophie, impressed "And your outfit shows off your cute breasts too".
Eve made a little "eep" noise and turned half-invisible, causing her two friends to laugh. "You look great" laughed Jessica.
"Yeah, mine started growing two years ago, still not as good as yours though" said Sophie, as Eve turned visible again "Mine are just less visible because I don't strut around in skin-tight spandex. You've got nothing to get self-conscious about - you're still the hottest thing in the school by a long shot."

"So anyway, did I tell you girls about my date last night?" asked Jessica.
"Ooo" taunted Sophie playfully "I still have the most dates though"
"Who'd you go out with?" asked Eve.
"Felix" said Jessica "He invited me to his place after school. We played video games mostly. It was heaps of fun!"
"Really?" asked Eve "Sounds great! He asked me out too."
"Your loss" taunted Jessica "Though it's cool how you're training so hard to be a superhero."
"Well - I did get a date of my own" countered Eve playfully "Sort of."
"I still have more" countered Sophie quickly.
"I was just giving Jack an interview" said Eve "But he has this huge crush on me, so it was kinda romantic."
Jessica laughed. "Eve, as of yesterday, everyone in the school has a huge crush on you. I'll bet even Percy has a secret crush on you but can't bring himself to admit it."

"Wait" said a boy loudly on the seats behind Eve "Did you guys hear that? Eve's dating Jack."
"Ewww!" chanted much of the bus "Jack and Eve, sitting in a tree! K-I-S-S-I-N-G! First comes the..."
Eve buried her head in her hands and turned invisible again.

As the bus approached the school, rather than a large number of paparazzi as her mother had predicted, Eve saw a completely different kind of blockade - a military one. There were tanks and loads of armed officers.

"What's going on here?" asked the driver, pulling over.
"Sir, we wish to speak to the young superheroine, Eve. You and the other students may pass."
"Eve!" called the bus driver "There's some soldiers here who want to talk to you!"
12211111111111.title: Eve gains more powers overnight

choices: Eve discovers more powers before lunch
Eve skips school after all to fight more crime
122111111111111.content:
Eve quietly flew off the bus after a short "best friend hug." She saw Percy chortle as she left, looking down on her with some bemusement now.
"Follow me, 'mam" said the soldier, leading Eve through the barricade towards a small tent. Eve flew inside, and finding an empty table and chairs, sat down there.
"Make yourself comfortable" said the soldier "I'll go fetch the general."

Eve rolled her eyes as the young soldier left and looked around the camp with her powers. It was quite clear that many of the soldiers didn't really know why they were there, and the few who knew that the "operation" was about Eve weren't really sure what Eve had done wrong. Eventually, Eve spotted the general strolling towards the tent. It turned out he was quite a young man, tall and blonde, and that apparently he was allowed to drink a bottle of whisky on the job.

"Eve" said the general, entering and taking a seat quickly, his hazel eyes darting about "Good to meet you. You really are as attractive as they all keep saying - for a young girl, I mean."
"You want to ask me out on a date too?" asked Eve calmly.
"Actually, no" said the general kindly "We have more important matters to attend to. The global geopolitical situation is quite fragile, as you know. The world has a lot of crime right now and we're doing our part to help fight it. That means mobilizing every resource we have at our disposal. In some places, this is quite challenging. There is no question that the criminal underworld is more powerful than we are, in aggregate. Additionally, in the last year we've waged many wars, as you know. The world is a dangerous place. But with you on our side, we could put an end to crime and bring about world peace."

"You want me - to fight for you?" asked Eve.
"Not just that" said the general "I'll be honest - what we're really after is your DNA. We had some covert forensic experts check the dairy yesterday, but have been unable to locate a usable sample. It seems that your cells break down extremely quickly when they leave your body. Therefore we must sequence the DNA from a sample inside your body - which will probably just mean looking inside your mouth and doing some quick tests on your saliva."
Eve sat back with a smile, putting her silver boots up on the table. "Tell me, general" said Eve "What's it to you? What would you do with my DNA?"
The general shrugged. "Well - if you must know, we want to study it and use it to create super soldiers" he said plainly.

"So you want me to help you conquer the world" said Eve "As well as fight crime, like I'm already doing?"
"Basically, yes" said the general "You could be an extremely valuable asset to this military and this country, Eve. Won't you pitch in and help us out?"
Eve sighed and put her boots down. "What do I get in return?" she asked.
"That's the best part" replied the general "Anything you want. Want gold? Hot guys? Want to be worshipped as a goddess? Want to become president? Want us to design you a better costume? Every person in the world your personal slave? I can make it all happen, and more. All I ask in return is to be allowed to look for a couple of minutes into your mouth with a team of scientists and instruments. You'll hardly even notice it. When the world has been subdued, there'll be no stopping us."

The offer certainly was tempting. Eve sat back and considered it for a moment. Although the terms were good, she wasn't sure if she could trust the general. After all, if there were many copies of her loyal to the general and just one of her, the general wouldn't really have to keep to the terms at all anymore once the world was his. She also wasn't sure that it was the best course of action. Somehow the idea of choosing one nation to rule the entire world doesn't sit right with her.

"Sorry general" she said at last with a sigh "I'll fight crime, and I'll bring world peace, but you have to let me do it my way."
"What did you say?" asked the general incredulously.
"General, you've become corrupted by power, I think" continued Eve "I too share many of the same ideals, but you don't need to rule the world with an iron fist to achieve them. You can still have freedom. You saw the power in me and your immediate instinct is that you have to control it. Soon you want to control the whole world with some super army. And that's why I don't trust you."

The general stood up and took a swig of whisky. Soldiers standing in the background seemed to waver a little. "Good speech" one of them whispered to another. Eve, for her part, was still relaxing in her chair with her boots up.
"So that's how it will be, is it?" said the general "You fool! You could have had everything your heart desired for all eternity, but you turned it away. Well, I won't let you go to have you work for the enemy! I'll make sure you're dead before that. Men! Open fire on her!"

The soldiers surrounded her and pointed their guns, but seemed reluctant to pull the triggers.
"What are you doing, men? I said open fire!" cried the general, drinking more whisky.
"But general, she has super strength" pointed out one of the soldiers.
"Does it look like I care?" replied the general, enraged "Obey your orders, men! Open fire!"

Somewhat reluctantly, one of the men started shooting. When he started, all the others did as well. Eve barely felt anything as the bullets bounced off her solid, super strong body. She did take her feet off the table and sat up a little, though.
"General! Our guns have no effect!" cried a soldier.
"Pull back! Regroup!" yelled the general "Bring in the tank!"

"Uhh - actually" said Eve "I'm sort of late for school now."
"If you go to school, we'll fire a missile at the school. Heck, I have no problem with launching a nuclear weapon against this town. You got that?"
At that, Eve stood up and suddenly flew over to the general, looking him right into the eye. Something about the way he'd threatened to attack innocent people really got her riled up and made her angry. "Don't... you... dare..." said Eve, feeling a mix of frustration and raw power bubbling up to the surface inside her "You take that back, right now, or you'll regret it."
"Never!" shouted the general, the heavy smell of alcohol on his breath "Give me what I want, or I'll make you regret it!"

Moving at super speeds and thinking quickly, Eve picked up each soldier, carried them to the park, gave them a wedgie, and hung them from some of the taller park trees by their underwear. She then took each of their guns that they had used to shoot her just moments before, and crushed them into a large ball. Then, finally, she ran back right in front of the general. All this happened in a fraction of a second, and the next thing he knew, the general heard various painful howls coming from the park, calling to be let down from the trees.

"You're not going to intimidate me by hanging up my men!" howled the general "I'll launch the weapons personally if I have to!"
Eve stared at the general angrily. "You just don't get it, do you general? I'm probably the last person you want to be making threats to. Those guys were just acting under orders. I don't mind that so much. What I mind is people like you who try to kill an innocent young girl for no reason - and then threaten to blow up her school, and her whole town!"
"You don't scare me!" said the general, taking another swig of his whisky bottle.

Eve shrugged, then stopped herself. "You're just a drunk, sad man" she said, composing herself "I won't hurt you."
"Of course you won't!" yelled the general "You're just a dumb bitch!"
With a sigh, Eve continued "But I will warn you - if you fire any sort of missile or weapon around here, my super senses will pick up on it, and I will turn that weapon around and throw it back at you. You know I can do that."
"Fine!" shouted the general, sauntering back and pressing a big red button "Go ahead!"

Immediately a large rocket fired in the general direction of the school building. With a supernatural reaction speed, Eve ran up to the rocket as it fired and, with absolutely no effort, deflected the rocket harmlessly into the sky. She also permanently disabled every piece of military equipment the general had with him before running back in front of the general. Eve and the general both watched as the rocket flew up and exploded harmlessly somewhere in the upper atmosphere a minute or so later.

"Well, what are you going to do with me?" asked the general "You'd never hurt me!"
"No, but I was going to give you a second warning as well" continued Eve "Your talk was quite boring, so just before, I used my super vision powers to read through much of one of my new law textbooks while you were blabbering on. Turns out you're in violation of at least 15 statutes and 24 military codes. So- I must warn you that even if I won't hurt you, maybe the full force of the law will knock some sense into you."

The next thing the general knew, Eve had used her powers again to carry him to the police station, and write up a short legal paper detailing his crimes in a super short span of time.
"He's all yours, officers" said Eve sweetly to the policemen as the general looked on with horror written on his face.
"You? You're that superhero?" asked one of the officers.
"Yeah!" said another officer "She stopped the robbery yesterday!"
"The name's Eve" replied Eve "Oh and, next time the army comes to town, keep a close eye on them, ok? This man literally just tried to blow up the town."
"We're glad to have a superhero on our side!" said one officer "Leave him with us. In the meantime, can we get a photo with you?"
Eve shrugged. "OK, but make it quick. I've got to get back to school."

"You'll regret this!" yelled the general as he was led away "We could have ruled the world, you and I! I just know you're going to regret this!"
122111111111111.title: Eve confronts the soldiers

1221111111111111.content:
Before she went back to class, Eve went off to the park to let down all the soldiers whom she had hung up. "Sorry everyone" she said "I kind of lost my temper there."
"That's ok, I think we all understand" replied one of the soldiers.
"It was our fault really, no need to apologize" added another.
"Maybe we'll get a new, better general now!" chimed in another.
"I thought it was really awesome to see what you can do in action!" said yet another excitedly, to which all the soldiers agreed. Eve looked away shyly.
"Aww, don't look away" said another soldier, as he hoisted Eve up and seated her on his shoulders "Three cheers for Eve!"
"Hip hip! Hooray! Hip hip! Hooray! Hip hip! Hooray!" cheered the soldiers.

"Well, I'm sorry, but I have to get back to school again now" said Eve, flying up off the soldier's shoulders.
"Aww" said the soldiers in unison.
"But I know I'll see you all again. Keep fighting crime and I'll help out when I can, ok?"
At this all the soldiers cheered and Eve flew off to the school, feeling great again. It seemed to her like whenever she became angry she lost control of herself a bit but her powers became stronger, while helping people out seemed to both make her powers stronger and increase her ability to control them. Either way her powers just seemed to become stronger whenever she used them, which she loved.

A short while later the principal was leading her to an old disused room, in which he had set up a small desk for Eve to work at.
"Sorry we have to do this" he said "There aren't a lot of spare rooms in the school, this was the best one I could find."
"I understand" replied Eve, flying into the room.
"Your books are over there" explained the principal "If you need anything, just come by my office"

Eve couldn't wait to get started. One by one she worked through all the papers. She soon realized that not only was she moving superhumanly fast as she worked, but she was actually thinking extremely fast too. Although she had four days to do a year's worth of material in the twenty or so papers she had been enrolled in, she completed it all in a matter of minutes. She even did her end of year exams right then and there, since using her super vision she already could see the questions, and using her super intelligence she already knew the answers.

She was about to fly off to the principal's office to ask him for more work, but then she stopped herself, realizing that this would be a prime opportunity to practice her powers. She began by practicing flying speed and agility, flying in complicated loops around the room at faster and faster speeds. She was really starting to get the hang of that, eventually stopping herself just before she exceeded the sound barrier for fear of giving herself away. She then revised invisibility, practicing turning herself invisible and back instantly, which again came to her quite naturally. Satisfied, Eve breathed out heavily, even though she wasn't at all tired, just out of habit.

As she did, she noticed something odd. In her breath, there was a single, tiny ice particle. Finding it strange, Eve breathed on to the window, concentrating a little on making her breath cold. To her surprise, soon enough, the whole window was covered in ice almost immediately. Curiously, Eve tried breathing something a little warmer. At first she surprised herself by making just a few flames come out of her mouth, but soon, with a little mental effort, she managed to breathe flames enough to melt the ice. Her flames caused a small fire in the classroom, but she used her ice breath to put it out before the smoke detector noticed.

"Awesome" she whispered to herself "Super breath!"

Eve took another deep breath in, and began practicing alternating between hot and cold breath. As with invisibility, this power seemed to come quite naturally to her. After only a few practices she was pretty confident that she could easily breathe both fire and ice.

Eve began to wonder what else her lungs were capable of doing. The next thing she tried was blowing. Securing all her school papers, Eve exhaled quite hard, the force of her breath causing the whole room to shake and knocking almost everything over. Quickly Eve stopped herself before the windows smashed. In another experiment she tried to blow only through a very small gap in her mouth very quickly, creating an effect similar to an airgun. She then combined that with her ice and fire breath, shooting small bullets of ice and fire through the air, starting small fires and putting them out just as quickly.

For a bit of fun, Eve decided to make an ice sculpture. Using her ice breath she first made a solid block of ice on top of her desk, and then she used her fire breath to strategically melt small parts of it away. It wasn't long before she had made an accurate scale model of the colosseum in Rome.

A little bored, Eve turned invisible and flew out of the classroom unnoticed. Finding a nice cloud, she blew on it, sending it a safe distance away from the town. Then she used her ice breath to turn it to a thundercloud, and her fire breath to melt all the rain again in an instant, causing a sudden heavy downpour below.

Eve flew about happily, testing her new breathing powers as much as she could. She remembered that some superheroes apparently had the ability to breathe things other than air. Eve wondered if that was part of her super breathing ability too, and her instinct told her that she could. First, she tried for outer space. Flying up quickly, she found that her instinct was, in fact, right - she was still breathing. What exactly she was breathing she wasn't sure. It was almost as though her lungs were generating their own air. Next she tried flying down to the ocean, breathing underwater. Again, she breathed as freely as if she was on dry land.

"I can't wait to tell Jess and Sophie about this" whispered Eve excitedly as she flew back towards the school for lunch.
1221111111111111.title: Eve discovers more powers before lunch

12211111111111111.content:
As Eve once again waited at the cafeteria she was met by Ryan, the captain of her soccer team.
"Hey Eve" he said "Wow you look..."
"I know" interjected Eve "I get told that a lot nowadays. I'll add you to the list of boys who want to date me."
Ryan smiled happily. "Thanks so much Eve! You're the best! Though, actually I'm here to talk to you about our team's game tomorrow."
"Oh? What about it?"
"Well, we're not sure if you should be allowed to play. Since you have powers and all, you're a lot better than the rest of us. There's the potential for injury, especially unintended injury. And also, soccer doesn't even have rules for using superpowers. Like, is it fair to fly with the ball? So we've sent something through to the regional authority, but until we get word from them that it's ok for you, coach thinks it's better if you sit this one out."

Eve looked down, a little saddened. "So... I might not be able to play soccer anymore now that I have powers? That... kind of sucks."
"Yeah" said Ryan "You were a good player. I'm not sure how we'll replace you. We can still go on a date sometime, though, right?"
Eve shrugged. "Sure, I guess."
With that, Ryan went away celebrating. "Thank you so much!" he called to Eve as he practically danced away.

"Couldn't help but overhear" said Emma, shuffling up to Eve "That you can't play soccer anymore. So... does this mean you'll have time now for the cheerleading thing? I think we're probably one of the few superhuman-friendly codes."
Eve rolled her eyes. "I'll think about it" she reiterated.
"Great! Well, let me know soon. We're just about to start work on some new routines and it would be sooooo amazing if you could join us."

Eventually Eve got her gigantic lunch and quickly found Jessica and Sophie.
"Hey Eve" said Jessica "What was that thing with the military?"
Eve laughed. "Just some general who got a bit carried away and tried to blow everyone up. He's on remand right now at the police station - I turned him in. Speaking of blowing things though, you'll never guess what new power I just got."
"What is it?" asked Jessica.
Eve blew gently on to her glass of water, causing ice cubes to form on it. "Super breath!"
"Neat!" said Jessica.

"Speaking of super, my class was super boring this morning" said Sophie "I can't wait - four more days and then it's holidays at last!"
"You doing anything fun?" asked Jessica.
"Yeah. Luxury cruise around the pacific islands, here I come!" replied Sophie.
"My parents are taking me on a ski trip" said Jessica "I'm so excited!"
"Oh" said Eve quietly "That sure does sound like fun."
"What are you doing, Eve? More superhero practice?" asked Sophie.
"I think so, yeah" sighed Eve.
"Well, I think that's way cooler than what I'm doing" said Sophie "I can barely imagine how great it must be to be you."
"And you can visit us on our trips at any time" pointed out Jessica "And we'll keep in touch by phone and such."
Eve smiled. "Thanks" she said "You two are the best."

Suddenly, Eve noticed that Jack was sitting alone on a table by himself. Percy, still wearing the neck-brace, and his goons marched over to him.
"Hey retard!" Percy said to Jack "What are you doing, nerd? You know the rules. Pay the nerd tax or get out of my school."
"But my dad said if I gave you my lunch money again..." began Jack, but he stopped when Percy put his fist right in front of Jack's face.
"You damn well know better than to listen to your father over me" said Percy angrily "Who are you going to listen to? The guy who spent most of your life in prison, or the guy who GENEROUSLY let's you get away with being a retarded loser in my school? You know I could waste you in a fight, so don't even try this kind of thing again. Who do you think you're kidding, nerd? You're the biggest weakling in the whole school, so you'll probably "
"Oh yeah?" said Jack defiantly "Well, my girlfriend could waste YOU in a fight, so there!"

"Girls, I'm going to have to excuse myself" said Eve quickly, feeling her sense of duty coming up again.
"Ooo" remarked Sophie excitedly "Fighting some bad guys? Can I watch."
"No" groaned Eve "It's just Percy thinking he runs the school again."
"Even better!" said Jessica excitedly "You show Percy who's the boss! Best friend hug!"

The three girls hugged together quickly, just as Eve saw that Percy was about to punch Jack in his jaw. Just as Eve was about to run at super speeds across the room to block the punch, however, Eve suddenly found herself already standing exactly where she wanted to stand, between Percy and Jack. Jack flinched massively behind her and fell right into his food, almost breaking the table, causing many students around him to laugh. Percy and Eve, however, just stared each other down. As they did so, Eve realized that she must have grown a little taller again as well, now being at eye level with Percy.

"So it's true then" muttered Percy "You really are that loser's girlfriend, freak?"
"No" replied Eve calmly "He's not my boyfriend. He's just somebody I gave an interview to yesterday."
Jack looked at Eve with a glance of betrayal. Then suddenly he ran away through the crowd, crying loudly.
"But that does not mean" continued Eve "That you have the right to mock, belittle or demand money from him. And if you can't get that through your skull, then I hope you remember the warning I gave you yesterday. I'd do the same to protect any student here."
Percy muttered something about freaks, but he turned away, giving Eve one last scathing look, and went back to his buddies.

At this the whole room cheered, and Eve flew up to allow the other students to admire her. Loudest of all were the cheers of Jessica and Sophie. Still, Eve wondered how she had moved in front of Percy so fast. Had she really teleported?

Eve decided that this was as good an opportunity as any to find out. Closing her eyes, she simply visualized herself flying at Jack's side, noting that Jack was currently alone in one of the classrooms, crying to himself. Sure enough, when she opened her eyes again, there she was, flying besides Jack exactly as she had imagined.

"Jack?" asked Eve "You alright?"
"Go away!"
"I'm sorry Jack. It's just..."
"Just what? It's all my fault. I made you look bad. You're far too good for me even if last night wasn't just some wet dream I had. I don't know why everyone else in the school is obsessed with you now too, but I need to learn to move on. I'm sorry Eve."
Eve giggled. "Jack, last night was completely real. You're the only boy I've ever dated, last night was my first kiss. I'm sorry that I don't consider you my boyfriend after just one short interview, but I'd like you to be my boyfriend. How about we make it official tonight?"
"You really mean that?" asked Jack, looking up to Eve with tears in his eyes "I know I'll never be good enough for an alien goddess like you but..."
"Stop that" interrupted Eve sternly "I actually really liked how you stood up for yourself before. I could have any boy in the world, but when you're being confident, there's nobody I'd rather be with than you."

At this, Jack threw his arms around Eve and hugged her tightly, still crying a little into her shoulder.
"One thing's for sure" said Eve gently, hugging Jack back "If you're with me or not, you and everyone else at this school won't ever have to pay Percy's nerd tax again."
Jack smiled at this, his eyes drying up a little, as he pulled out of the hug awkwardly. "I love you" he whispered "So much more than you know."
Eve simply smiled warmly and tousled Jack's hair, before teleporting back to her friends to finish her lunch - but not before tidying up the mess that had been made when Jack fell over and bringing Jack some of her own food at super speeds.

"Hey girls" said Eve excitedly "You won't believe it! I JUST got a new power! I can teleport now!"
12211111111111111.title: Eve discovers teleportation

choices: Eve's mother has a surprise for her
Eve just practices her force-field powers more
122111111111111111.content:
When lunch was over, Eve did a quick patrol around the school, ensuring that students weren't breaking any school rules, before returning to her otherwise vacant room. As she flew in, she noticed a bunch of students had left her love notes under her door. She read them all quickly, before filing them away in one of the desks in the classroom.

"Hmmm..." said Eve to herself "I'm going to need a space where I can practice my powers..."
Blowing quickly around the room, Eve coated everything in a thick layer of ice, holding it all tightly in place, and sealing the room off.
"Time to get started" she said.

Eve first warmed up by practicing her new teleportation power all over the place. She was soon teleporting across the room quite naturally. She began to wonder if the powers she had received recently were just easier to control, or whether she was getting better at using her powers through practice.

She didn't have much of an oppertunity to consider the thought, however, as soon her super-senses picked up on another crime in progress - an arsonist had just struck the local department store. Looking around the store, she saw in shock that the roof was just about to collapse, and there were people still trapped inside.

Acting quickly, Eve blew fire around the room just enough to evaporate the ice, leaving the whole room thick with hot steam, before rapidly breathing some cold breath to normalize the temperature. She blew the resulting heavy cloud out of the room into the corridor, leaving it to dissipate there. Then, in a flash, she teleported right into the burning building just as she noticed part of the roof was about to collapse on some poor shop clerk.

"You're just in time!" he shouted to Eve "I'm trapped! Help me!"

Eve flew across to him and lifted the collapsing roof above him with ease. "Don't worry, sir" she said "You focus on freeing yourself - I'll protect you."

Eve then noticed a guy unable to get out because of the heavy smoke. He was choking and needed urgent help, which made Eve appreciate how easily her super eyes could see through the smoke. Using her super breath, Eve solved the problem by blowing the smoke away, while still holding up much of the roof. Just then, however, Eve saw at the other end of the store that a kid in a wheelchair was trying to get out, but the wheelchair access ramp was blocked by flaming debris. Just then, a huge burning fan that had been hanging from the roof fell down. Eve wondered what she could do to help but she was too preoccupied with holding the roof up to hold up the fan as well. With her breath out, and not able to think of a solution in time, Eve's eyes grew wide with horror, and she wished that somehow, the fan could be held up.

No sooner did she think it, than a shimmering force field appeared right above the trapped kid, holding up the fan easily. "Did I just get another power?" she whispered to herself.

There wasn't much time for reflection though. Realizing the fire appliances were still too far away, Eve realized that she'd have to do quite a bit of work herself if she wanted to save much of the store, as well as the lives of the dozen or so people still trapped inside. First she used her super strength to crush the section of roof that was collapsing, allowing the smoke to escape more easily. Then, she began running around the room at super speeds, using her ice breath to counter the flames and blow out the fire everywhere. The people inside just saw a small white blur, and a few moments later, the heat was all gone and the smoke started to clear. With a little super blowing from Eve to get the smoke out, the store was actually quite chilly. Eve also freed everyone who was trapped by clearing the debris using her super strength, her muscles bulging out a little as she worked them.

"What's that shimmering thing above that kids head?" asked one of the crowd of people who were once trapped inside, now gathered around Eve.
"Oh, ummm... that's a force-field, I guess" said Eve. Finding a small half-burnt soft toy, she threw it against the force-field to demonstrate, and it turned out exactly as Eve had thought - the toy bounced off it. Eve then tried concentrating on removing the force field, and... this time she failed.

"Can you make it go away again?" asked the middle manager.
"Hold on a moment, I'm trying" said Eve "New power - might take me a moment to learn to control this..."

The crowd backed away a bit in case something bad happened. One of the braver civilians helped the kid in the wheelchair get away as well. Meanwhile, Eve concentrated harder and harder, but removing the field was tougher than she thought. She also tried using her super strength, but that only allowed her to move the force field or change its shape, not to destroy it completely.

"You can do it!" cheered the boy in the wheelchair "I believe in you Eve!"
Just then some very confused fire fighters turned up. "What happened here?" asked one of them.
"Shhh!" said the crowd in unison, watching as Eve concentrated. Getting the hint, the firefighters started working on the clean-up very quietly.

After half an hour or so of intense concentration, the force field began to shimmer a little as Eve concentrated harder on it. This roused the audience, captivated, and made them cheer harder.

Finally, just as school ended, Eve did it. The force field shimmered softer and softer until eventually it wasn't there any more at all. The crowd cheered exceptionally loudly. Panting a little from the intense mental effort, Eve flew down and signed a few autographs for her fans in the crowd. "Guess I need to practice that force-field power a little more" she told them sweetly.
"You're doing a great job, you know" said a firefighter "Without you, most of these people would be dead."
"Well you do a great job yourself" replied Eve "I'm just some kid with some powers - you save lives every day for a living with no powers. That takes a lot of courage!"
And with that the crowd cheered the firefighters also.

Meanwhile in the local park, the arsonist had just dumped an empty bottle of gasoline into the local river, watching as the heavy bottle sank to the bottom. When he turned around again to leave, however, Eve had just teleported there to meet him.
"Oh, ummm - hello, cutie" he said, looking around shiftily.
Eve looked at him sternly. "If you were looking to get my attention you could have just asked. Now I'm afraid I'll have to send you to jail."
"Oh" said the man, still looking around shiftily "Well, uh..." and with that, he suddenly punched Eve and tried to run.

Eve barely even felt the punch through her super strong body. She rapidly flew up, picked up the man by his coat, and tossed him into the river, leaving him soaking wet. "That's for punching me!" she laughed as the man splashed about.
Then she picked up the man again and carried him at super speeds to the police station. "And this" she added, handing a quickly written statement to the officers there "Is for setting on fire the department store, almost killing hundreds of people."
"Two major crimes in one day?" asked a police officer.
"Just doing my duty" saluted Eve with a smile and a wink, before teleporting away again back to school, just in the nick of time to make the school bus and catch up with her friends.

"So, how was your afternoon?" asked Jessica.
"Oh my god... you will not believe this!" said Eve excitedly.
Sophie and Jessica looked at each other. "Actually Eve, with the sorts of amazing adventures you've been on recently, I'm pretty much ready to believe anything you say you did at this point" shrugged Sophie honestly.
122111111111111111.title: Eve discovers making force-fields

choices: Eve flies out to meet Jack
Eve is interrupted by a crime in progress
1221111111111111111.content:
Eve's bus arrived without incident, and as she left, Eve happily noted that Percy didn't seem to be in the mood to disturb anybody. Quickly flying home, she was just about to retrieve the key from under the rock out of habit, before remembering that she could just teleport inside now. Doing so, she hopped on the couch and decided to take a break after a long day full of heroics. Using her super vision powers she started catching up on a few of her favorite TV shows which she'd been missing in the last few days where she'd been too busy due to her new abilities.

A short while later Eve's mother arrived. At first Eve flew up to greet her in the garage but then suddenly she felt a strange ringing in her ear. Her eyes began to blur and fog over, and her flight seemed to give out too. As her mother came closer, a strange tingling filled her body, which became increasingly painful the closer her mother came. Eve tried to scream in agony but found that her voice wasn't there anymore. She could barely still move and was suddenly having trouble breathing. Through her blurred eyes she could see that even her young, beautiful body was slowly transforming into an old, ugly one.

Eve had almost forgotten what pain felt like ever since she became super strong, but this was unlike any pain she'd ever felt before. "Help" she managed to get out "Help, mum..." and then she started choking. Her heart started beating quite irregularly too. And then, through her blurred vision, she could just see that her mom was carrying a small black stone in her hand.

"This little stone is the xenotime I told you about earlier" said her mother "It's effects should be obvious - it reverses all your powers. The more super you are, the weaker you become when xenotime is around. Your strength, your vision, even your super beauty disappear when xenotime is around, and are replaced by their opposites - exceptional weakness, poor vision and ugliness. And if this stone were to ever touch you, you would die instantly."

With that, he mother sealed the stone inside a small protective case of solid steel, and Eve was able to breathe again, gasping loudly and holding her throat.

"There is nothing you can do about it, before you ask" added her mother "There is no way you can get immunity to the stone. Even when you become otherwise omnipotent, your powers will have no effect if you try to use them on the stone or around it."
"Wow" gasped Eve "That's way more powerful than Kryptonite."
Her mother smiled and hugged Eve gently, as Eve felt her strength return quite quickly, her eyesight clear, her body changing back to its former beautiful glory. "It's alright, Eve" replied her mother "You're much more powerful than superman after all."
"So what you're saying, mom, is that I'll be omnipotent in every respect, once I develop my full powers, except that I will always be helpless against the stone?" asked Eve, to clarify.
"Yes. The stone is the one thing that can always destroy you Eve. But then again, you can protect yourself against the stone's power a little, too. As long as you stay away from it you should be fine."
"So mom - how rare is xenotime anyway?" asked Eve.
Her mother shrugged. "It's quite rare. You don't just see it lying around" she said "But it is easily obtainable. You can buy a crystal like this one on the internet for about a thousand or two thousand dollars. Like diamonds really. The purified crystals are the ones to worry about - impurities, which are very common, make xenotime exponentially less effective against you."

Eve sulked a little. "I was really looking forward to that unlimited power thing!" she said "This all makes my powers seem kind of ... limited."
Her mother laughed. "Did Superman give up because of Kryptonite? No, he fought harder. In the end, as some Chinese philosopher once said, the love of the people is always your strongest defence. Make people like you, and then nobody will ever want to hurt you with xenotime or anything else. Your powers are a gift, Eve. Use them wisely and make yourself worthy of them. I just want you to know what being around the stone does to you and your body, so that you can be prepared."

===

"Urgh - who on Earth do you think you are?" asked the General, who was nursing something of a hangover with more whisky, of the shadowy figure in the interrogation room at the police station.
"I am the secretary" replied the secretary calmly with her cold, empty-sounding female voice "I'm here to talk to you about the little girl who put you here."
"You want to talk to me about Eve?" asked the General, slamming his fists on the interrogation room's table "That stupid little..."
"I understand your frustration, General" replied the secretary "And I have a plan to destroy her, but I could use your help. Your pay will be handsome. When she is gone, the world shall be ours to rule. Everything is now in place. World domination is within my reach, but I am a cautious villain. I will not proceed until she is destroyed."
The general shrugged. "How can I help? I'm in prison."
At this the secretary shifted uncomfortably. "I'm afraid I cannot reveal the master plan here" she whispered "I just need you to trust me on this. After all, think of all the power I'm promising you. The power to rule the whole world. And more importantly, you'll at last be able to get the revenge I know you so deeply desire."
The general sighed. "Alright" he said "I'll help you. Tell me what I need to do."

===

That evening after dinner, where her mother concluded that Eve was indeed now immune to all kinds of poison and disease following one last field trial, Eve was flying above her house, practicing removing force-fields she created. It was not getting any easier. She was still having to concentrate for hours, sometimes, to remove a force-field. She was still practicing with little progress as the sun set and into the night, until her mother finally called her in right after she'd cleared another force-field.

"Hey mom" she said slyly as she flew down "I think I have a new super power. It's called super not needing sleep."
"It doesn't matter" replied her mother "It's still your bedtime."
Eve sighed and, at super speeds, got herself ready for bed. She did, however, take a normal speed shower, at which point she noticed her body proportions had changed again, becoming increasingly curvy.

"Hey mom" said Eve as her mother tucked her in "Other than the fact that I'm developing all these super powers, have you noticed anything... strange recently? About me I mean?"
"Not really" replied her mother.
"Well, it's just... I know my breasts are still quite flat, but it's a lot of growth for one day, I think."
"It probably just seems that way to you now, sweetie."
"I've also been getting taller and... well, I've been having feelings for this boy..."
"All normal parts of puberty" shrugged her mother as she turned off the light "You'll get used to it. Just wait until you have periods."
"Mom, do you think it's possible... maybe I'm going through puberty a bit faster with all these powers?"
Her mother thought for a moment. "It's possible" she said at last "But I'm sure it will still take many years either way. I wouldn't be too concerned about it. Just focus now on developing your powers - and on going to sleep. Good night sweetheart."
Eve pretended to yawn. "Good night mom" she said.
1221111111111111111.title: Eve's mother has a surprise for her

choices: Meeting the Dark Alliance for the first time
12211111111111111111.content:
Once again, Eve wasn't really the slightest bit interested in going to sleep. Looking through her own eyelids with her supervision, she watched as her mother went back downstairs, and listened in as she got busy placing an order for a new table by hire-purchase. To avoid any kind of suspicion by inadvertent noise-making, Eve teleported out of the home before flying off in the direction of Jack's house.

She saw Jack with her powers, in his bedroom waiting for her. Like her, he had clearly pretended to go to sleep, but was now dressed in a cute little suit and holding a white rose in front of him, clearly waiting to surprise Eve when she arrived. Chuckling cunningly to herself, Eve teleported silently into the house so that she was right behind Jack before lightly tapping him on the shoulder.

Jack almost screamed in fright, dropping his rose and falling backwards as he spun around seeing Eve. Flying quickly, Eve scooped him and his flower up, lifting him with ease. "You ready?" she asked in an excited whisper.
Jack was still in shock for a moment, shaking heavily, but eventually he managed to nod. Eve gently put Jack back on his feet to compose himself, while she got to work on quietly opening the window. When it was open, she quietly whispered "Let's go" before picking Jack up and flying off into the night.

"Where are we going?" asked Jack, nervously hanging on to Eve tightly as the two pre-teens soared higher and higher into the sky.
"I don't know" asked Eve playfully "Check out how cool all the lights look from up here though."
"Yeah... pretty sweet..." replied Jack, still shaking "Hey Eve, it's really cold up here - can we go back down a little bit?"
Eve sighed, forgetting about her apparent immunity to extreme heat or cold. "Sorry! I forgot about that!" she replied, flying a little further down "Hey - want to sneak into the cinema?"
Jack looked a little unsure but eventually relented after thinking about it for a moment. "Sure" he said, to which Eve smiled.

The next thing he knew, Eve had carried him at super speeds to a late screening of a romantic comedy film. Looking around, he found that not only had Eve taken him to some of the best seats in the house, but she had also procured a large packet of popcorn, a selection of drinks and some sweets for him as well. Eve was sitting on the seat beside him, but leant in to him a little. "Say, is that flower for me?" she whispered.
"Oh, errrm - yeah" replied Jack, quickly presenting it "I'm sorry it's not much but..."
"It's beautiful" said Eve, examining it before taking it from him "I love it."

A short while into the movie, one of the ushers at the cinema suddenly shone the torch at both of them. Immediately Eve turned herself invisible in a panic, leaving Jack to tumble and spill one of his drinks across the floor.
"What are you doing here? Do you have a ticket?" asked the usher.
"I... I... I'm sorry, I..." began Jack, on the verge of crying.
Just then Eve re-appeared behind the usher. "Hey Peter, how's it going?" asked Eve.
"Eve? You're the girl who saved my marriage last night!" replied Peter.
"The one and only" replied Eve, striking a cool superhero pose she'd been practicing.
"Thank you so much" said Peter "Hey, could you help me out again? This kid's been sneaking into the theater."
"Oh, him?" replied Eve, flying over to Jack's side and holding his hand "He's with me. We're out on our first date."
"Aww, you two look cute together" said Peter "Alright Eve, I do owe you one, so I'll let you off the hook this time. Just remember to ask first next time, ok?"
Eve smiled, her beautiful eyes gleaming in the usher's torchlight. "Sure thing" said Eve "Let me know if you ever need me again, too. Bye!"
Peter smiled back before moving on.

"That was close" sighed Jack "Why didn't you rescue me and get out of here?"
Eve shrugged and hugged him. "I wanted to finish the movie" she said before munching away on one of the candy bars.

When the movie was over, Eve took Jack back to the park. Jack was quite tired and full of candy but still holding up admirably.
"Eve?" asked Jack as the two lay next to each other, basking in the full moonlight.
"Yeah Jack?" asked Eve.
"Thank you so much" replied Jack "I hope my teeth are ok after all that chocolate though."
Eve giggled. "I hope you don't mind" she said "I made a couple of million little force-fields inside your mouth, protecting your teeth. You won't have to worry about tooth decay from now on."
"Wow" said Jack quietly, half-yawning.
"So sleepyhead" said Eve, playfully knocking Jack's shoulder "You got any other questions you'd like to ask the world's greatest superheroine?"
"Oh yeah" said Jack, quickly collecting himself and saying the first thing that came to his mind. "So are you... are you, like... my girlfriend now?"
Eve chuckled. "Sure, I guess. I might still date around a bit, but you're by far the best boy I know."
"So I noticed you're not in class anymore? What are you doing?"
"More advanced papers from the university - easy stuff, really. Mostly I'm out saving the day or practicing my powers."
"What's your coolest power?"
"Hmmm - my ice breath is pretty cool. Jokes aside, all my powers are the best."
"Is it true you could destroy the planet in the blink of an eye?"
Eve tapped her super muscular arms. "Of course. But I would never do that."
"Well then I think you're literally perfect" marvelled Jack "I mean, you don't have any weaknesses or anything, right?"

Eve stopped. "Well, ummm...." she began "Maybe I do have one?"
Jack looked at her curiously. "Oh? What is it?"
For a long moment Eve considered telling Jack the truth, but then she realized that even if she knew he was genuine, she was too afraid of anybody finding out about her true weakness to say anything. "It's nothing really" she eventually said.
"Come on" replied Jack.
"Honestly, come of think of it" said Eve playfully "I think my biggest weakness might just be how much I really like you."

Jack smiled warmly and, although tired, he and Eve both gave in to instinct. Their heads drew closer and closer together as they gazed deeply into each others eyes, warm breath from their mouths mixing in the rapidly narrowing air between them, before suddenly...

"Oh my goodness, is that the time?" said Eve, moving back alarmed as she noticed the town clock out of the corner of her supervision "I'm really sorry Jack, but I'm going to have to bring you back to bed."
Jack looked outraged. "But Eve, I'm not even tried" he said tiredly "Can't we just stay here?"
"Nope, I have urgent superhero business to attend to" replied Eve "Got a note last night to meet somebody, and I get the vibe that they're not a good guy."
"Can't I come watch?"
"No, you're too tired anyway" said Eve, who by now had already carried Jack into his bedroom and deposited him in his bed at super speeds "I'll tell you how it went tomorrow".
"But Eve..." began Jack, before Eve silence him with another quick kiss on his cheek. Once again, Jack was too stunned to say anything as Eve smiled and teleported away, attaching the rose to her suit.

"And now for my next appointment" said Eve to herself as she flew towards the interstate bridge "Time to find out who the secretary is."
12211111111111111111.title: Eve flies out to meet Jack

choices: Eve wakes up the next morning to find her house robbed overnight
Eve wakes up to new powers
122111111111111111111.content:
Eve flew out to the bridge and scanned around with her superpowered eyes. At first she assumed the mysterious secretary was held up or something, but then she saw that she was a few minutes early, and that a small boat was approaching the bridge carrying just one person on it, watching her as she flew. Something about her look made Eve quite sure that she was the person who wanted to meet her.

The secretary was an attractive middle-aged redhead with lightly freckled skin. She was quite tall and had cold grey eyes that rarely seemed to blink. Her outfit was a neat and tidy business dress, and she carried with her a small black leather handbag, inside of which Eve could see a small handgun and some money. Eve flew over and landed at the rear of the boat, which seemed to be a small fishing charter. The two stared at each other as the redhead turned off the boat engine and waited for the noise to die down. A slight breeze whipped up both of their hair and made the whole scene seem very tense. In the distance, a storm cloud seemed to be raging and lightning cracked violently across the sky.

"Are you the secretary?" asked Eve at last.
"Indeed" replied the secretary quickly, cautiously walking towards Eve.
"What did you want to see me about?" pressed Eve, a little annoyed "I had to interrupt a date for this."
"Well Eve, it's quite curious you should ask" said the secretary, finally standing uncomfortably close to Eve with her large body "I've been hearing about your super heroic exploits. And of course, when I hear about something like that, it's my duty to learn and file away everything there is to know about you. It's what allows us to adapt and respond. It's what makes us stronger."
"I'm sorry, but I'm not in the mood for interviews tonight" replied Eve definitely.
"I wasn't asking for one. I've heard every conversation you've had with your mother since the beginning. After a bit of searching and cross referencing, Eve, I know more about you than you know about yourself."
"But... how can that be? I scanned my home for any bugs or listening devices - I've seen every wire in our house."
"Then you should have seen your mother's laptop. Twenty years ago I developed a perfect piece of malware - always evolving, and always adapting. One of my smarter creations, it now infects over ninety percent of computers worldwide, and none of them are any the wiser."
"Alright then. I'll just destroy my mom's computer."
"I have my backups. Not least among them, your cellphone. I could direct every spy satellite in the world to listen in on you every second of every day if I wanted to. Trust me, Eve, that's not a battle you can win, at least with your current powers."
"Why are you telling me this? Do you want me to arrest you for spying on people?"
"As if you're not doing the same thing with your super hearing."

At this point the conversation quietened down a little again. The breeze picked up a little more, and the air grew chilly. Eve sat down. "Look, secretary, what do you want?"
"Quite frankly, I want to help you" said the secretary "I'm not that evil really, nor am I ever a liar. Honest. In fact I want to make you more popular than you've ever been before. Turn you into an international sensation. I want you to become so popular..."
"You want to conquer the world? 'Cause I've already put one general away for that."
"No, I want to improve you" replied the secretary "You're already pretty great, but you're not yet perfect like you should be. I can help you with that."

At this the secretary reached into her back pocket and pulled out a small white pill.

"With this pill, you can be immune to xenotime" continued the secretary "This pill allows you to overcome all your own limitations. And the best part? I'll let you have it for free. Consider it a tribute to the future goddess of the universe. Of course, Eve, I already know you'll decline and throw this pill away. Power isn't what you really want, is it? In fact, you don't even like your superpowers, do you?"
Eve snatched the pill angrily out of the secretary's hands. "I do too like my superpowers!" she burst out "I'll show you!"
"Oh no you don't" said the secretary, clearly getting excited "You hate them - remember all the fun you used to have when you were a regular girl? When your life was all about video games and soccer and girl guides? Now you'll never be able to do any of that ever again! That is the price of power - that is the sacrifice you must make for the good of mankind. If you were smart, you would do it. Even now, though, I see you hesitating. I fully know you won't."
"Power doesn't scare me" replied Eve cockily "In fact, I enjoy my responsibilities. I'd love more powers if that meant I could help people more!"
The secretary smiled and whispered to Eve snakily. "Go on then. Let that desire for power grow inside of you if you really want to embrace it. Let it out! I know you have it in you, even if you deny yourself your destiny. Isn't that why you were BRED, Eve? To create a being of perfect and ultimate power - and here you are, chickening out at the mere thought of it. What a disappointment you are. A superhero with so little courage and so little power. I knew I wouldn't be up against much of a challenge when I execute my little scheme."
"You're wrong!" said Eve "You made a big mistake giving me this! When I get my power, I shall ensure every wrong-doer is put to justice!"

With that, Eve put the pill up to her mouth. For several tense seconds she just stood there, jaw open. Then, however, her rage seemed to go away and her head cooled down again. "I see what you're trying to do" she said at last "You're trying to corrupt me with power, aren't you?"
"You're only convincing yourself" retorted the secretary "Every day when you practice your powers, you do that to improve yourself - not for the good of humanity, but for you. I've dealt with heroes and villains for a long time, Eve. I know your type. Openly you're humble enough, but deep inside, you only care about your powers now. Slowly your powers are already making you forget how much you enjoyed living a normal, stress-free life as a normal, carefree girl."

Eve sighed, and handed back the pill. "I'll get my powers when I'm ready, so I don't need your little pill. I'm sorry. I work alone and don't need candy from any strangers, alright? And besides, I don't really trust you."
The secretary smiled, took the pill and ate it. "It's alright, it was indeed just a bit of candy anyway. Tastes delicious but wouldn't have otherwise affected your powers."
Eve was stunned for a moment. "Why... why did you do that?"
"I am the secretary. I learn things and catalog everything. I don't destroy anything myself, though if I need to I can manipulate people into destroying themselves. That's my little superpower. I was just conducting a little psychological experiment to understand you better. When my master plan goes into action, Eve, I want you alive, because you're going to be a part of it whether you like it or not."

Once again the two stared each other down. Finally Eve asked "What master plan?"
"You can choose to work with me, Eve, but you cannot work against me. If you want to contact me, I'm sure you'll see me around."
Eve frowned, again annoyed. "Don't you dare waste my time" she warned, her temper again flaring "Tell me your master plan."
"Oh, I do like it when you get angry" chuckled the secretary, turning the boat engine on again "You're so cute."

Suddenly flames began flickering lightly from Eve's skin, and her muscles bulged out a little. Internally Eve was becoming increasingly annoyed and angry. "Tell me before I make a force field in your throat." she said darkly.
"That's it, Eve" called the secretary over the loud sound of the engine as the boat began moving through the water "Deep inside, Eve, I know there's evil in you yet. Let it out on me! Force me to tell you everything!"
By now a raging inferno was surrounding Eve, as she felt herself grow slightly and her muscles bulge out further. Just as her rage threatened to control her entire mind and body, however, Eve stopped herself as she realized the secretary's boat was on fire. Getting a grip on herself with a giant mental effort, Eve's body returned to normal and the flames surrounding her disappeared. "I'm sorry!" said Eve quickly, blowing out the fire with her ice breath "I didn't mean to do that!"
"Go to bed little girl" grinned the secretary "You look like you're getting tired from all that raging."

Eve sighed. The secretary was right. She was getting tired.
"I'll be watching you" said Eve at last.
"Goodbye" said the secretary neutrally as Eve teleported back to her room and shut her eyes.

As her eyes shut, she thought she saw the general walking the streets as a free man. Too tired to investigate, though, she rapidly fell into a deep sleep, hovering mid-air above her bed, with the assumption that he was on bail or the like.
