1221111111111111111111.content:
Eve jolted awake with a start. A pair of fiery red lasers shot out of her eyes and narrowly missed her mother, who was trying to shake Eve's levitating arm awake.

"Eve! What the heck!?" growled her mother angrily as two large holes burnt into the wall behind her while Eve got her laser vision under control.
"I'm sorry mom!" replied Eve in shock and fear, flying back a bit "I didn't know I could do that! Honest!"
Her mother looked at Eve sternly. "You're a superhero. It's your duty not to use powers that you can't yet control, understand? Even accidentally."
"Yes Mom" said Eve, breathing heavily with relief that her mother was alright "You scared me."
"Then maybe you need to practice not using your powers. That way you won't be so tempted to use them when I try to wake you up in the morning."
"But Mom!" objected Eve.
"No buts about it. I want you to stop using your powers for as long as you can, starting right now."

Eve sighed heavily, before slowly levitating down to the ground.
"Now no matter how many monsters are destroying the city or how many people are being killed all around you, I want you to try to control yourself and not use your powers. Understood?"
"Yes Mom" sulked Eve.
At this, her mother bent down a little and hugged Eve. "Don't worry, sweetheart. I don't like doing this to you, but I'm really afraid you might hurt somebody, especially now that you're more powerful than you know. I know it'll be hard, as your instinct is to use your powers all the time, but please try to fight it for a little while. Super patience is a super power too, sweetie."
"I get it Mom" replied Eve "I'm really, really sorry that I almost killed you. So... um... what did you want to wake me up so suddenly for?"

Her mother stood up again, sighing. "We had a break in last night. A couple of things got stolen here and there. Our TV, my computer, my jewellery..."
Eve was stunned. "What!" she exclaimed.
"The thieves took off with a lot of valuables but they left the Zenotime behind. I suppose they didn't know about its effect on you, so you're safe. Whatever happened to your super not needing sleep power?"
Eve deadpanned. "That was a joke, mom. But this is serious! We have to catch them! What was the model number of our TV? I'll use my super vision to..."
"No you won't" interrupted her mom "This one we'll leave to the authorities, sweetie. You need to practice not using your powers. If you keep away from using your powers all day, then tonight maybe I'll let you practice being the night watch lady of the city. Then maybe your body can learn not to need sleep."
"A full day!" exclaimed Eve "But Mom - I feel like I really need to breathe fire, or teleport somewhere, or turn invisible! What about practicing my laser vision!?"
"Sorry Eve" laughed her mother, kissing her cheek lightly "But being a superheroine isn't just about developing your powers. It's also about learning when not to use your powers."
Eve groaned as she walked off towards the bathroom, annoyed at how slow each step seemed when she wasn't using her super speed.

Eve stepped on to the school bus sadly. Since she wasn't allowed to be a hero, she'd changed back into some of her normal clothes for school.
"Finally realized your outfit sucks, dork?"
"Shut up Percy, I'm not in the mood for this."

"Hey Eve, what's going on?" asked Jessica as Eve sat down "What happened to your awesome costume?"
"I don't really want to talk about it" said Eve, slumping back in her seat.
"Did you lose it battling a super villain or something?" asked Sophie "Was it really embarrassing?"
Eve chuckled a little. "Nothing quite that bad. I would definitely talk to you two about it if there weren't so many other people here."
"Why not use your super speed to take us somewhere private where we can talk, then?" asked Sophie.
Eve didn't answer.

Just then, Emma, who happened to be sitting in the seat opposite the trio of friends, leaned over. "Eve, can you show me how you do that flying thing again? Might just give me some inspiration as I work out our routine..."
"Emma, I still haven't decided to join cheerleading" replied Eve.
"Don't worry about the suit!" continued Emma, not really listening "I'll make some calls - we can get you into a totally sexy outfit that'll blow..."
Eve felt her frustration grow, as though letting out her annoyance at not being able to use her powers. "I don't want to be a cheerleader!" she shouted loudly and defiantly.

A stunned silence filled the bus, as all eyes fell on Eve.
Eventually Ryan stood up. "Eve, I know soccer's always been your thing, I'm really sorry" he said "Emma just suggested to me that you try it tonight when we have our big game. We could really use your support - if we win this we go through to the regional semifinals. So - I mean - please don't take it personally, alright? Heck, I wanted to let you play, coach just wouldn't have it."

Eve sighed. "Sorry for shouting at you Emma" she said at last "I'm just a bit stressed this morning. I'll be there to support the team, Ryan. Don't worry."

"I get it" interrupted Percy, standing up with a wicked smile and still wearing the neck brace, which he'd painted midnight black with red skulls "Little Eve is too embarrassed. You're just a little crybaby with superpowers!"
"Hey, shut up" said Ryan nervously "Eve's my friend."
"Is that right?" asked Percy, walking over "Well I'm your master. This is my school! Eve may be the hero of the day, but I'm still the king in the end! So choose your next words wisely, if you don't want to get crippled before your big match!"
Ryan backed down in the face of the intimidating stare of Percy. "I... I'm sorry..." he whispered "Don't hurt me..."

"You see Eve!" called over Percy "That's what real respect looks like! In fact since Ryan respects me so much, he's going to voluntarily give me all his lunch money, right now! Aren't you, Ryan?"
Ryan looked at Percy in horror, before giggling nervously. "I... I didn't bring any lunch money. Must have forgotten it at home, silly me..."

The next thing Ryan knew, Percy punched his face so hard that it caused his whole body to shake, jiggling several coins in his pocket.
"See Eve, this is how it's done!" explained Percy as he reached into Ryan's pockets. Ryan looked as though he'd been knocked out cold. "This is how you do it Eve! Even my punches make losers like Ryan richer. Don't you worry about him - I'm just giving him what he deserves! You should try it! Don't mess around with all that crap about being good or your lame costume! Being a bully is SO much better. Best decision I ever made! Come on, don't be a wuss! Lash out at people! Maybe then you won't be so much of a freak."

Eve covered her face in her hands, trying really hard to control herself and not use her laser vision to rip Percy to shreds right then and there. "Do something!" whispered Jessica to her.
"I can't" whispered Eve back "I'm not allowed to use my powers until tonight. My mom said so."
"But this guy needs your help!" whispered Sophie, joining the huddle "You're not going to just leave your captain behind are you?"
"I told you" replied Eve "I can't! I really want to, and I feel really angry, but I'm holding myself back as best I can!"

In total frustration, Jessica clapped her hands and stood up. "I'm not taking it anymore" she said "Give back his money"
"You want a piece of me too?" screamed Percy, flailing his fists. Eve looked up at Jessica, confused. "Don't do it" whispered Eve.
"Me too" chimed in Sophie "I'm not taking it anymore. Give back his money."
"Give it back" added Emma, standing up.

One by one, each student in the bus (with the exception of Percy's small gang of goons) stood up, saying the same thing. Eve and Percy were, for once, united - both staring around the bus unsure of what was going on or how to react. For a moment, looking around, he was totally stunned and looked a little defeated, almost as though he was seriously contemplating giving the money back. Just then, however, the bus driver tooted his horn.

"Would you kids all sit down!" he called from the front of the bus.
Percy snarled. "Sure, no problem driver" he said as he took Ryan's money back to his seat. Ryan was just starting to stir again.

"See?" whispered Jessica to Eve as the bus calmed down and took their seats "Sometimes you don't even need your powers to be a hero. Sometimes all it takes is a bit of courage. That's what my grandma always used to say anyway."
"Jess, that was amazing!" replied Eve, still stunned "Your grandma must be really wise."
Jessica laughed playfully. "Hey, you're the one with super intelligence here! I guess your super wisdom will come soon too."
"Yeah, but Percy's still got Ryan's money" pointed out Sophie.
"I'm sure our favorite superhero can... ahem... *deal* with that later" replied Jessica, before bursting out laughing.
"I still can't believe I can't use my powers for a day. It really sucks" said Eve "I... I feel like I'm just about to burst or something. Like I'm not using all this power and it's all inside me, struggling to get out."
Sophie laughed. "Just make sure you don't accidentally let it all out on me!"
Eve groaned, forgiving her friend for reminding her of her near-homicide experience that morning.
"Alright girls, two more days of school" said Jessica as the bus stopped outside the school "Time to have some fun! Best friend hug!"

Soon Eve left the bus, feeling more normal than she had in a long few days.

123.content:
Luca had just started middle school, but didn't seem to be running out of cute points - his handsome young face, with sweet hazel eyes and dirty blonde hair, made it difficult for him to blend into a crowd, even though he was only of average height. His father, Ben, was the sort of man who didn't like to draw too much attention to himself. He was retired, had a small apartment on the outskirts of the city, and spent a lot of time playing video games. Luca wasn't sure exactly what his father had done for a living, or why he didn't seem to look much like him - he loved him all the same. Most of the time Ben allowed Luca to hang out anywhere around the city where they lived, so Luca could spend a large amount of time just hanging out with his friends. As for his mother, all Luca knew was that she was gone. Ben never wanted to talk about it.

At school, Luca was quite popular, but always busy. He was captain of the swim team, soccer team, and the chess team. When he wasn't occupied with one of the many clubs he was involved with, Luca was doing extra homework or reading advanced books. He did have some enemies around the school though - and of those enemies, the biggest one was Macie. Macie was a tall brunette girl who was obviously a future supermodel. She loved inventing things, and her inventions were always brilliant. The only problem was, Luca was always getting better grades than her. It made her jealous to no end. What was worse, Luca seemed to be the only boy in the school who didn't always do things her way just because she was pretty. Every night she dreamed that one day, she could build a giant killer robot and destroy Luca once and for all.

This particular autumn day had been a really long one for Luca. After a busy day at school, he had just enough time for a quick game of soccer at the park before catching up with one of his buddies from the swim team, Caleb, who was celebrating his birthday at the pools. After partying with Caleb and his friends into the night, Caleb's mum dropped Luca off outside his father's apartment. Somewhat tired, Luca took out his key and opened the apartment door.

"Dad, I'm home!" Luca called out above the distant video-game sounds.
The game sounds stopped and Ben poked his head around the corner. "Did you have fun at the party?" he asked.
"Yes dad" yawned Luca.
Ben smiled. "Looks like it's time for you to head for bed" he said.
"Good night, Dad"
"Night, Luca"
And with that, Ben went back to playing his video game.

Luca streched his arms and wandered sleepily over to the bathroom. As he lazily brushed his perfect white teeth, Luca already felt like he was half-asleep. He began imagining what it would be like to fly - to be able to soar up through the air and effortlessly glide around the world. Almost subconsciously, Luca stood up on his tippy-toes, one arm brushing his teeth, the other outstretched. He closed his eyes and imagined the cold air rushing past his earlobes, his clothes brushing in the wind against his skin, and his eyes seeing the most amazing sight - the whole city, from above.

Then, Luca opened his eyes to spit and rinse his mouth. It was only after he did so that he noticed something very peculiar - he couldn't feel the floor under his feet anymore! Startled, Luca let out a quiet gasp as he looked down. It was hard to see from his angle, but it did indeed look like he was floating a few centimeters in the air! Luca barely supressed a shriek as he began to wonder how he was going to get down again, and then suddenly dropped the short distance to the ground with a thud.

Luca's heart beat heavily. For a moment he thought perhaps his father had heard the noise, but luckily the sound of the video game must have drowned it out. He looked at himself in the mirror again. Did ... did he just levitate? For all that he had been tired mere seconds ago, now the young preteen was wide awake and wondering what was going on. Levitation? That was impossible. In fact, Luca could quote verbatim all the scientific theories that proved it. It couldn't be true ... or could it?

With a hurry, Luca walked briskly to his room and shut the door behind him. He pulled out of his chest of drawers a stack of old comics that he had picked up at a book fair years ago. His eyes gleaming, he flicked through pages and pages of pictures of superheroes, defeating bad guys across the galaxy. Was he crazy? Had he just been tired? These questions did cross his mind, but in that moment, he was too excited to care. What if he really had floated? Perhaps he could be Luca, protector of Earth and savior of mankind? He began to wonder if he had any other powers as well.

The excitement waning a little, Luca thought to try his powers again. He drew the curtain on his window in case anyone was watching, and wished to fly.

Nothing happened.

A little frustrated, Luca sighed, but he tried again. This time, he tried it a bit more calmly, as he had been in the bathroom. Cross-legged he sat down on his bed as if to meditate, imagining himself flying. This time, slowly ... ever so slowly ... the boy felt the bedding move away from his legs.

"Yes" he whispered to himself as he began to rise gently off the covers. He kept going until he was no longer touching the fabric with his legs. As a test, he reached down and put his hand between himself and the bed, to make sure he was really levitating. Then, equally slowly, the boy imagined himself landing, and began to float down.

"I've got to learn to control this power" he said to himself quietly while landing "This is so cool! I'm like a real-life superhero!"

However, by that time the young boy had begun to feel tired again. Whatever powers he had, he reasoned, he could explore them the next day. With another yawn, he changed into his nightwear, turned off the light, and quickly dozed off to sleep, as the sound of video games clanged in the distance.



Meanwhile, on a faraway planet, a pretty alien girl with sweet hazel eyes and dirty blonde hair was being interrogated.

"We know you've had a child with a protected species" growled the interrogator "And you know the penalty for such horrific acts. Tell us where you are hiding this child, or we will be forced to push for the maximum punishment."

"I don't have to tell you anything."

"That is your choice. Tell us, or we will have to kill both you and your baby. And believe me, we have ways of making this extremely painful for both of you. At least tell us which planet you had this child on ... and you will both be spared the death penalty, albeit left to rot in prison. Perhaps your child might get parole one day. After all it's not fair on them, is it?"

"I'm innocent. That's all I have to say."

"Lying won't do you or your child any favors. We will find them. Our scouts left our planet this morning, travelling through wormholes to every corner of the galaxy. When they find the planet and locate your child, their orders are to blow the whole place up on sight without warning. Now granted, scanning millions of planets could take months ... or, if you're unlucky, perhaps they are just minutes away from destroying your beloved child. Clock is ticking - when you are ready to tell us where your child is, just let me know."

With that, the interrogator left the room as the alien girl began to cry.

1231.content:
Luca woke up the next day feeling fresh. He began to go through his morning routine, first heading to the bathroom to take a quick shower. After cleaning himself, he took a moment to style his hair and admire how good he looked. Then he went back to his bedroom, put on a clean set of his school uniform, and tossed his dirty clothing from the day before into the laundry. Next, Luca crept past the lounge where his father was still asleep, into the kitchen to make himself two sandwiches for breakfast. After eating those, Luca went back to the bathroom to brush his teeth. Only then did he remember about the strange evening he had the night before.

Closing his eyes, Luca held out his arms and once again floated softly into the air. He breathed heavily in excitement as he watched himself rise gently in the bathroom mirror, before landing again like a feather. "So awesome" he whispered to himself, before diligently brushing his already-perfectly-healthy teeth.

There was little time for exploring his powers then and there, however, as Luca knew the school bus wouldn't be far away. With some urgency now, Luca packed his school bag, and left the apartment quietly enough to allow his father some quality sleeping time. Thankfully he didn't have to wait long at the bus stop down the street - Luca had something of a sixth sense concerning how far away the bus was from his home.

First period - writing. Luca knew just what he wanted to write about today - superheroes. Excitedly he jotted down page after page of stories about famous heroes, while at the back of the class, Macie just stared at him enraged.

Second period - physical education. The PE teacher took the students to the hall to practice juggling. Within minutes Luca was happily juggling a large assortment of sharpened knives, while Macie huffed beside him, unable to keep more than three balloons in the air simultaneously.

"Urgh, I'm having a bad day" sighed Macie as she headed out for recess.
"Would you like me to get you a drink of water?" asked one of her hangers-on.
"Yes please - I think I might be sick" replied Macie.

Luca exited the class after her, surrounded by a mob of admirers. In the distance, Caleb caught his eye. Thanking those around them, Luca rushed over to talk to his swim-team friend.
"Hey Caleb - you won't believe what happened to me after your party last night!" said Luca.
"Did you find $50 on the ground or something?" asked Caleb.
"Nope" smiled Luca "Much better. Come on, I'll show you."

Luca led Caleb around the back of the school to where the rubbish was dumped. "You know this is out of bounds right?" whispered Caleb "We could get in big trouble if we're caught here!"
"That's not important right now - I need you to keep this a secret, okay?"
"What could possibly be so important? You're always a goody-good."
"Watch this"

Luca closed his eyes, and Caleb couldn't believe his! Right in front of him, Luca was really floating up into the air. Caleb walked around him, crouched down to get a better view, and held his mouth agape in astonishment.

"Pretty cool, huh?" said Luca softly. He was trying to make himself move forwards to impress his friend, but so far had only mastered a soft up-and-down motion. With some experimentation, he was able to gently "pull" himself forward with his arms up. He rolled around and found it quite comfortable to do so lying flat, although it was a bit awkward at first.

Caleb watched his friend figure out the mechanics of his flying power in awe. "What ... how are you doing that!?" he said, only slightly mindful of avoiding making noise.
"I don't know" replied Luca honestly, softly lowering himself back to ground level "It doesn't make any sense to me either". He had been almost two meters off the ground, barely even realizing how high he had gone.
"Does this make you kind of like a superhero?" asked Caleb.
"I guess so" shrugged Luca "It makes me wonder if I have any other powers, and why I have these powers in the first place."
"Maybe you should ask your dad" replied Caleb "I mean, it does kind of make sense ... you are good at everything after all."
Luca brushed it off "Come on now ... you're an awesome swimmer."
"Yeah and you've got every single school swimming record to your name" retorted Caleb "You've gotta admit, that's superhero-esque."
"Alright fine, but ... I still couldn't do it without all of you."

Next period - maths. Once again the tension in the room was palpable. Macie rushed through a page of her middle school grade mathematics textbook, glancing up in hopes of having beaten Luca for once. In the time it took her to do just one page, however, Luca had gone though an entire advanced university-level calculus textbook without making a single error on any of the exercises. Macie wanted to scream in agony.

Fourth period - science. While the other students made simple rockets out of balloons, Macie and Luca (being advanced students) were allowed to work on their own air-powered rocket designs. Macie worked really hard on hers, both to make the design look awesome and to make sure it could fly at a great distance. As she was about to present her cute little rocket to the teacher, she saw Luca had already completed his. Macie launched her rocket out of the sky and was proud that it made it all the way across the school courtyard. "Beat that!" she taunted Luca. Shyly, Luca launched his own rocket out the window, which promptly blasted off into the sky and disappeared with a little twinkle.

"Urgh, I've had it!" yelled Macie as she stormed out of the classroom. A few other students rushed after her, asking if she was alright.

During the lunchtime break, Luca locked himself into a bathroom cubicle and thought about his schedule. Writing up a brief plan on a sheet of paper, he began adding times for superpower practice. He needed time, he reasoned, to develop and hone his powers before he could be a true superhero ... the awkward flying he had demonstrated to Caleb during interval just wouldn't cut it.

After finishing that, Luca had to go to a student council meeting. Macie, he noticed, wasn't there at her usual seat. He hoped she'd be alright. The meeting itself went fairly smoothly ... mostly the teachers just wished to know whether students liked the design of a proposed new playground, and everyone agreed that they did.

Fifth period - reading. Luca headed for the library, found himself some superhero comics, and read them with newfound enthusiasm. He imagined himself in each of the stories, and began to wonder what sort of a moral code he would have as a hero. Would he ever kill a bad guy? Luca thought probably not, but what if it was by accident? He reasoned that he'd really have to learn to control his powers. He couldn't wait to explore whether it was just flying he could do, or other things as well. Across the room, Macie spent the whole period glaring at him through bloodshot, tear-stained eyes.

Final period - music. Here Macie pretended to compose her own music on the computer, but was constantly distracted by Luca improvising some insanely good piano music.
"Uhm ... if you want us to tell him you like him, you know we're there for you, right?" asked one of Macie's friends gently.
"I do NOT like him!" huffed Macie.
"Oh ... I just thought since you keep gazing in his direction, maybe..."
"Don't you dare get me started" replied Macie "I'm the pretty and talented one here, not you and certainly not him. I'd rather die than have to date the likes of him!"
"If you say so" said her friend tauntingly.

After school, Macie was one of the first to leave. Immediately she speed-dialed a number on her phone. "Mother, you won't believe what happened to me in school today!"

12311.content:
Not wanting to disclose his powers to too many others before he had a chance to talk with his dad, Luca called up Caleb after school. The boys met up in a secluded spot in the local park.

"Alright, I've made a list of every superpower I can think of" said Luca, handing his friend a long sheet of paper "Let's see if I'm developing any of them. You check off the powers if you think I might have them. Of course I could always develop more powers later on, but I want to see what I'm already capable of maybe without realizing it."
"Okay" replied Caleb with a grin "I think we'd better get started!"

"Super hearing!" read out Caleb, directing Luca to tell him what various people in the park were talking about. With little difficulty, Luca found he was able to distinctly hear any conversation in the whole park that he focused on. "Check!" called out Caleb as he ticked it off his list.

"Super vision!" ... this time, Caleb directed Luca to look up at a distant airplane and describe all the passengers he saw through the windows. Luca surprised himself with just how well he could do this, almost effortlessly focusing his gaze through each individual window and describing what he could see inside. "Check!"

"Shapeshifting!" ... Luca closed his eyes and imagined becoming a dog as hard as he could. "Is it working?" he asked. "Nope" replied Caleb, crossing it off his list "I'd say that one's not a check. Let's move on."

"Flying!" ... Luca happily demonstrated his ability again for his friend. It seemed that each time he did it, flying became a little easier ... "Check"

"Teleportation" ... Luca concentrated on disappearing and reappearing behind his friend, but it didn't work ... "Not check"

"Super Healing" ... Caleb took a needle and tried to prick Luca's skin with in. Try as he might, though, the needle wouldn't pierce the skin. The boys looked at each other in confusion for a long time ... eventually, Luca agreed to allow Caleb to stab his arm with a knife. Again, though, the knife wouldn't go through his skin no matter how hard Caleb pushed on it. Even when Luca stabbing himself as hard as he could, there was no way he could make the knife go into his body. By the end of their experiments, Luca was completely unharmed but the knife was looking somewhat blunted. "Let's put a question mark next to that one and check off super durability instead" said Caleb. Luca nodded in agreement.

"Time travel!" ... Luca tried to go back in time to see when Caleb had woken up that morning. Again, though, nothing happened. "Not check"

"Super intelligence" ... Caleb took one look at Luca ... "Check"

"Super speed!" ... Caleb had Luca sprint around the track of the field as fast as he could while he timed. Luca was a blur as he set off, darting around the field at speeds that left bystanders in awe. Luca was just concentrating on running, until he noticed that he was going faster than the cars on the road beside him. He slowed down a little to avoid attracting too much attention before returning to Caleb. "How fast was I?" he asked. Caleb just stared at his timer in disbelief ... "Let's just check that one" said Luca, who wasn't even remotely tired from his sprint.

"Telekinesis!" ... Caleb asked Luca to make an acorn float with his mind. Luca concentrated really hard, but it wouldn't budge. "Not ch..." began Caleb - "WAIT!" interrupted Luca "I could swear I just made it move!" ... Luca kept concentrating and Caleb saw that the acorn was indeed moving a little from side to side, but it was such a small movement he had hardly noticed. "I guess I'll put a question mark next to that one" replied Caleb.

"Intangibility!" ... Luca jogged against a tree, hoping to pass straight through it. The reaction was as expected, and Luca fell to the ground as the whole tree shook and buckled from the heavy impact. "Not check" replied Caleb.

"Super strength!" ... the boys made for a creek near the park, where a heavy old log had fallen. With some strain, Luca lifted the log and carried it out of the ankle-deep creek. "Wow that was heavy" he said, drying his feet and putting his shoes back on. "It's heavier than anyone else around here can lift - they were going to get a digger in to pick that up, you know" replied Caleb "I'm checking it."

"Underwater breath!" ... Luca held his face underwater and, throwing caution to the wind for a moment, let a big gulp of water into his mouth. It felt like he was choking at first, but when he breathed the water out again, it began to feel more natural. After about a minute, air bubbles stopped coming out with his breaths and Caleb came to check on him, but Luca was completely fine breathing underwater! "No wonder you're so good at swimming ... Check!"

"Mind reading!" ... Caleb picked up playing cards from a deck and asked Luca to read his mind and find out what cards he was seeing. At first this was easy as Luca could see the reflection of the cards from the glint in Caleb's eyes with his super vision, but then Caleb hid the cards behind a bush. Luca concentrated on Caleb's mind as hard as he could ... thinking about what Caleb would be thinking about right now ... and took a bit of a guess. "King of hearts?" he asked. "Yip" replied Caleb. The boys repeated the experiment a few more times and each time, Luca's "guesses" proved right, much to his own surprise. "Check" replied Caleb.

"X-Ray vision!" ... This time, Caleb had Luca concentrate on the bush itself, rather than his mind. Luca stared at the bush, trying to see past it ... and shocked himself when the bush started to disappear before his very eyes! He was so startled that he lost his concentration, and the bush reappeared, so he had to try again. It felt like an incredible rush, to know he must have developed some of these powers a while ago but never thought to try them. Each time he did it, it became much easier for him to do as well. Needless to say, he correctly named every card. "Check!"

"Invisibility!" ... Luca closed his eyes and concentrated. A gasp from Caleb let him know it was working! "Hey Luca, take a look at yourself!" said Caleb with a chuckle. Luca opened his eyes and couldn't see himself or his clothing at all! "Woah - this is so cool!" he said, peering all around where his body should be. Then, ever so slowly, he made himself visible again. "I think that power is one of my favorites" he said. "Check" replied Caleb.

"Fire breathing!" ... Luca tried to make a small fireball come out of his mouth. He noticed his breath was a bit warmer than usual, but no fireball. "Not check"

"Enhanced combat!" ... Luca stood across from a Karate master at a local dojo. He saw the master lunge at him almost in slow motion - and with superhuman dexterity, Luca ducked out of the way. It was as though he somehow knew exactly where to push the master to make him fall down - in a swift motion, Luca had the black belt squirming on the ground, pinned down by Luca's super-strong foot. "Check" said the karate master.

"Enhanced beauty!" ... The boys went down to a local modelling studio for a tryout. Caleb was quickly rejected, but Luca was immediately offered a large sum of money to model a brand of underwear. As he walked on to the set, the underwear showing off all his best features, the photographers were stunned and offered him a large bonus to entice him to come back again. "Check" they all said together.

A few more tests later, the boys were lying on the grass in the park, watching the sunset.
"That was pretty amazing" said Caleb "Already you've got more powers as a kid than just about any superhero. If you keep developing powers and honing the ones you have, you'll be like a god!"
"Yeah, I guess so" replied Luca timidly "I mean, using my powers is fun and all. But being just a regular kid is pretty nice too."
"You mean, you don't want to have powers? Be a hero? Save the day?"
"Of course, but I'm thinking of people like Macie. People who try so hard but will never be as good at these things than me. They need to know that they matter, too."
Caleb sighed. "Don't worry about her. She's just jealous, that's all. I'm sure once you get established as a superhero, even she'll come around."
"You think?"
"I'm sure of it. Now - let's go home. I'm sure your dad must be waiting for you."
Luca smiled. "Thanks for helping me out, I appreciate it" he offered.
"Anytime, super-buddy" replied Caleb "See you tomorrow!"
12311.title: Superpower practice after school

choices: Luca does something else the next day
123111.content:
Luca opened the door of his father's apartment. "Dad, I'm home" he called out.

The sounds of video games in the room next door stopped and once again, Ben poked his head around the corner. "Good to have you back, son" he said "There's some leftover pizza in the fridge if you're hungry."
"Uh - dad? Can I talk to you for a minute?"
"Sure, son. Come on in, take a seat."

Luca wandered into the darkened living room. His dad was there, lounging on the couch with a video game controller in his hand. Some kind of first-person shooter was displayed on the large screen. All around the room were scattered random food scraps, beer cans and old bits of packaging. The whole room hadn't been cleaned in years - indeed, such would have been the fate of the rest of the house, had Luca not kept it tidy. Luca sat down gently on a torn lounge chair, wondering why his dad chose to live this way. Briefly he considered reading his mind to find out, but then he remembered his thoughts in school about a moral code. Perhaps he shouldn't use his mental powers too much without permission.

"So, uhm... last night" began Luca "I kind of figured out that I can fly."
Ben nodded gently. "And... ?"
"And after school I discovered I actually have a ton of other superpowers as well."
"And... ?"
"And I think I'm still developing my powers. I'm noticing that the more I use them, the more powerful I become."
Ben raised an eyebrow "Okay but I mean, what's your point?"
Luca eyed his father. "Doesn't that ... surprise you? I mean, most kids don't exactly have superpowers."
Ben chuckled. "Your mother wasn't like most women either."

Again Luca was stunned. "You ... you never talk about ..."
"Well, this would have to be an exception. Have you told anyone about your powers?"
"Only yourself and my friend Caleb, why?"
"It's best you keep them a secret. Only tell those you really trust. That's one reason I have to stay hidden."
Luca's eyes grew wide. "Do... do you have powers too?"
"Oh no, nothing like that. But if they find me, they can find you too. Your mother entrusted me with your care, since I can be better hidden than she can."
"Wait wait wait ... who are 'they'?"
"I don't know for sure. That's the only word she ever used for them. But they are dangerous and they will stop at nothing to destroy us all if they find you. Even their motives, I don't know. Your mother had many secrets, and I knew from the moment I first saw you, you're bound to have many secrets inside you too. Your mother warned me that even she could not predict what you'd grow up to be, whether it would be good or bad for the world. But in my heart I always knew you'd grow up to be a good person. I knew that if there was a single gene from me in your body, it would be my heart."
"So I'm like the son of Supergirl or something? Wonder Woman?"
"Kind of" replied Ben with another chuckle "She's not a character you'd know. She didn't really have any 'powers' in the conventional sense either, so far as I know. But she certainly wasn't human. The only person who I can say looks even remotely like her, is you. You remind me of her every single day. It's hard. I miss her so much. But I know it's for the best."
Luca blushed. "Where did she go?" he asked.
Ben paused. "I think that's all you need to know for now" he said slowly "I'll fill you in on the rest when the time is right."

Luca went over to the kitchen, took a cold slice of pizza out of the fridge, and put it in the microwave. As he watched the pizza slice spin around, he replayed his brief conversation with his dad over in his mind. Who was he? What was he? If his mother was not a human, what was she? Who was hunting him, and why? He didn't mind keeping a secret identity - actually he quite liked the idea - but he still wanted to know more. Again the temptation was there to just read Ben's mind and find the answers, but again he stopped himself. He couldn't do that, especially not to his own father. What did this mean for him and his powers? He certainly still wanted to use his powers, but if it put the world in danger... ?

The timer on the microwave beeping interrupted his thoughts. Luca took the hot pizza out of the microwave and munched on it slowly. After finishing his light dinner, Luca went back into his bedroom and closed the door. Perhaps he was worrying too much, he thought. After all, he could scarcely help the fact he was handsome, and hadn't even told his father how he had earned hundreds of thousands of dollars just by posing for a camera a few hours ago. Perhaps he just had to learn to accept his destiny, and be brave despite the challenges. Whoever 'they' were, he somehow knew he could take them if he tried.

Emboldened with his newfound confidence, Luca practiced again and again, drifting up and down into the air, and moving back and forth. He was starting to be able to control his flight a lot more, and could move at close to walking pace. Flying felt relaxing and exciting all at once - all he had dreamed of the day before. After a few hours of practice, Luca got himself ready for bed and drifted off to sleep.




Just beyond the solar system, a small alien spaceship flew through a wormhole into vision.

"Any of these planets habitable?" asked the ship commander, feeling bored.
"Our scanner shows that there's a protected species on one of the rocky inner planets, sire" reported the navigator "I believe it's called Earth by the local creatures."
"What a silly name" mused the commander "Alright, I suppose we'd better fly in to take a look."
The flying-saucer-shaped ship put on its cloaking shield, protecting it from being seen by any prying astronomers, and zoomed in towards the earth at speeds much faster than light itself.
123111.title: Talking with Ben

1231111.content:
Period one - art. "Perfect," thought Luca, as he sketched out a superhero costume for himself. Making himself unrecognisable was a particular challenge, so he considered a few options to disguise his more recognisable features - a helmet, a balaclava, thick sunglasses, a mask, and many more options crossed his mind. Eventually, he settled on wearing dark blue spandex with a diamond pattern over it, together with blue-tinted goggles and a set of white boots. On his chest, Luca first considered drawing a big red "S," but thought better of it - he wanted to be his own hero, not a superboy rip-off. So instead he drew a red diamond, adopting that as his symbol.

Period two - reading. Luca took his picture with him and refined it further, based on what he saw in comic books around the library. He added black trims to the spandex and a black set of briefs. He also added a white cape that came down to his ankles, and some black face-paint to further disguise his appearance. Finally, he added his red diamond symbol to his boots and the back of his cape. He figured that if he was going to be a hero, he might as well have some brand recognition.

Interval came quickly as Luca was having lots of fun designing his costume. However, he had another idea as well.
"What do you want, freak?" asked Macie angrily as Luca approached her.
The girls around her rushed up to Luca, trying to show him a picture on their phones - it was him at the modelling shoot the day before. Already it seemed the pictures were going viral around the internet, and the company was making millions of dollars. The girls started chattering about how good he looked.
Luca tried to smile. "Uhm, Macie? Can I talk to you privately?"
All the girls around gasped excitedly, their imaginations running wild.
Macie gave in. "Okay, but make it quick. I'm already late to cheerleading practice."

Luca took Macie to an empty classroom, using his x-ray vision to ensure nobody was around.
"This better be good" said Macie.
"Listen, I know you don't like me, but I need your help" said Luca.
"Forget it" replied Macie instantly.
"No, hear me out" replied Luca "See, watch..."
Luca floated up into the air. "What the heck?" said Macie loudly as she watched Luca's feet leave the floor.
"I've got these superpowers" explained Luca "I only found out about them two days ago, I swear. I'm sorry for upstaging you all these years - I never meant to grandstand or anything. You're by far the best student at the school at everything - I don't really belong here."
"Figures" replied Macie simply, sitting down on a chair and looking sad.
"I want you to be my manager" explained Luca "I need somebody to make a costume for me, help me to train my powers, support me in fighting crime. I got a lot of money from a photoshoot yesterday, so you can have all the resources you need. Together we can fight crime and help people all over the city."
Macie's first instinct was to refuse - she didn't care about crime. All she cared about was destroying Luca once and for all. But this did present an opportunity for her - after all, she had heard the saying "keep your friends close but your enemies closer." Perhaps by joining forces, she could find out about Luca's weaknesses and exploit them.
"Alright" said Macie "I'll do it. But how will I explain this to the girls?"
"Oh, I think I have the perfect alibi for us to hang out together privately..."

"So yeah, Macie is my girlfriend now" said Luca with a smile while Macie went off to cheerleading practice.
"Yip... it's true" replied Macie reluctantly, feeling humiliated.
All of Macie's friends cheered for her. "Oh my gosh, you're so lucky!" they said, followed by various comments about how cute he was.
"So Macie, can I stay over at your place tonight?" asked Luca very publicly.
"Sure, lover" replied Macie spitefully.
"And your friends won't disturb us, will they?"
"Of course not" they all said together, although one of them whispered to Macie afterwards "Do tell us all about it afterwards, ok?"
"No problem" said Macie, unaware that Luca's super-hearing could understand the whole thing.

The following classes went by relatively quickly. At lunch, Luca went to the school pool for swim team practice.
"How'd it go with your dad?" asked Caleb in the changing room.
"More questions than answers" replied Luca "He said my mother wasn't human and that 'they' are out to get us."
"He sounds like he's been playing too many video games"
"Yeah, but two days ago the idea of me being a superhero would have been crazy too"
"Not to me. I'd have picked you for the 'most likely to grow up to be a superhero' trophy if there was one."
"Well, if one day you started figuring out you could fly, I bet you'd think it was weird."
"Well, whatever you are" said Caleb, teasingly punching Luca in the arm "I sure am glad you're loyal to your friends."

After swimming practice was over, one of the girls from the team - a short brunette girl called Haley - came over to talk to Luca before he got changed.
"Hey" she called out "What's the deal with you and Macie?"
"She's my girlfriend" replied Luca shiftily.
"Come on, I know that's a lie" replied Haley "I know you're not the kind of boy who'd date a girl just for her looks or her brains. I always figured you'd be more into sweet charming girls who stay out of trouble."
"Sorry to let you down I guess" replied Luca "I'll do my best to keep Macie out of trouble."
"Well if you ever get tired of doing that and want somebody who will actually take care of you and love you forever ..." said Haley, trying her best to look cute "You have my number right?"
"I'll keep you in mind" said Luca.

In the changing rooms, Luca sighed. He definitely wasn't even ready for a relationship full stop, and he knew Haley sure as heck wasn't either. She was always a quiet, diligent girl - the daughter of a local winemaker, raised on religious values. But a relationship was just too convenient an alibi. Besides, he knew Macie wouldn't get any ideas ... he wondered how long he could maintain the relationship? What if later on Macie found somebody who she actually loved, or what if he decided he'd want to be with somebody more like him, such as Haley?
"Dude, if you're thinking about Macie and stuff, don't worry about it" said Caleb reassuringly "I know exactly what you're doing and I think it will be fine."
"I just hope I don't break too many hearts" said Luca "I hate hurting people ... especially girls like Haley."
"Adults always say they need to learn to cope with it anyway, so what's the big deal?" replied Caleb "Just go with the flow. Things will turn out fine."

After lunch finished, Luca made a point of always sitting next to Macie in class. Macie cringed every time, but thankfully it wasn't hard to pretend to be interested in a boy universally acknowledged to be the most attractive in the school. She considered asking him for the answers on a maths test, but thought better of it, still caught up in trying to beat him despite his superhuman intelligence. Every time she was frustrated, she wanted to cry out again, but instead just smiled and pretended to be happy for her new boyfriend's constant success.
1231111.title: Luca develops his secret identity

12311111.content:
"Oh my gosh, you two are like the cutest couple!" screeched Macie's annoying little sister, Stacie "I can't believe my big sister is dating..."
"Shut up Stacie" said Macie, slamming her bedroom door in her little sister's face and locking the room.

Luca looked around at all the cool gadgets and inventions Macie had lying around. With his super-vision he zoomed in on some random circuit board he saw lying around and admired Macie's attention to detail. "This stuff is pretty cool" he said.
"Whatever" replied Macie, not even looking at him "Let's just get this over with."

Macie had Luca strip down to his underwear and lie down in a converted sunbed. A laser scanned all around his body and took precise measurements, which were uploaded to Macie's computer. Macie scanned Luca's drawing and applied it to the 3D scan of Luca's body, allowing the two preteens to see a precise 3D visualization of the costume before it was created.

"Looks good" smiled Luca.
"Let's make it happen" said Macie, pushing a big red button on the screen with her mouse.

Immediately a converted commercial copier beside her computer sprang into action, drawing out lines of fabric and cutting them into precise strips. Macie fired up an old sewing machine and carefully stitched each piece together, occasionally finding other materials from various drawers around her room. As she finished stitching each piece, she applied a small amount of solvent to the stitches, to help protect them. Macie did this with the speed of a seasoned expert while Luca waited patiently, not that he had to wait very long. Meanwhile, the computer completed simulations on the suit to ensure it would stay together even under "super" conditions.

At last the suit was finished exactly as Luca had envisioned it. Macie put a special spray all over the suit to further protect it and make the suit itself bulletproof. Then, at last, Luca tried it on and looked at himself in the mirror.

"Now THIS - is a superhero!" cheered Luca.
"I still think you look too recognisable in it" replied Macie "I don't know many eleven-year-olds with abs like yours, sorry."
Luca frowned "Well, it's basic protection anyway. Maybe I should disguise my voice too, just to be safe."

Luca turned himself invisible - much to Macie's astonishment - and flew outside. At first it was a little unsettling, leaving the window in that way, as Luca was disused to it, but soon he flew upwards into the sky. Still his movements were slow and a little awkward, but he was really starting to get the hang of it - a vast improvement from the clumsy floating he was doing a few days before. He could now move as fast as an average person's running pace, though his own ground speed remained much faster. After some time getting used to wearing the suit, he flew back into Macie's room and turned himself visible again.

"So does the suit fit well?" asked Macie.
"Sure does" replied Luca "See, this is why I needed your help. If I'd tried to do this, it would have taken much longer."
"Great" replied Macie "Now since we're pretending you're my boyfriend, I'm going to need you to do something for me in return. And don't even think about breaking up, or your whole superhero secret will be exposed to the world."
Luca gulped.

"Don't worry" continued Macie, idly brushing her hair "All you have to do is forfeit all your trophies and awards at school because you cheated. And I mean, isn't that pretty much the truth? Superhuman advantages count as cheating, don't they? And while you're at it, remind the principal who has been coming in second place year after year. Apologize in front of the whole school for being a liar and a cheater and tell them I'm really the best at everything in the school, not you! And finally, demand from him that the school give all due compensation to me for all the emotional distress I've had to suffer because I was undeservedly robbed of all my trophies."

Luca nodded. "You sure that wouldn't just attract more attention?" he asked.
"I don't care" replied Macie "I deserve to be the queen of this school, and if you're my boyfriend I expect you to treat me as such."
Luca was unsure about this attitude, and guessed he'd try to figure the situation out.
"I'll see what I can do" replied Luca, his voice betraying his concern.
"And hey, look on the bright side" continued Macie "Maybe if you do exactly what I say I'll let you kiss me and help you out with more of your superhero stuff. Now get out of my room."

No sooner had Luca left the house, than Macie had begun carefully swatting the converted sunbed, taking tiny samples of Luca's sweat and putting them carefully into containers marked "Superhero DNA." "Now," Macie chuckled evilly to herself, "Now comes the really diabolical part of my plan."

Luckily, Luca wasn't listening at the time. Instead, he headed directly for the corner store, now dressed in his school uniform again - he needed some candy to cheer himself up. Macie sure was driving a hard bargain but he did have to admit she had a point - Luca wasn't human, so that made it something of an unfair competition.

At the store, there was a young boy at the counter. "Sorry but this isn't enough" said the elderly cashier "You're almost five dollars short to pay for this candy."
"I'll cover it" said Luca happily, handing over the money.
The cashier smiled. "Thank you" said the young boy joyously, racing out of the store with his candy.

Luca moved to one of the aisles while the cashier put the money away in the till. Soon afterwards, however, a teenage boy entered and pulled a knife from out of his back pocket. "Hand over the money in the till!" demanded the teenage boy.
In shock, the cashier almost fell back and stammered somewhat. "Hurry up!" yelled the boy, directly holding the knife against the cashier's throat. Shaking in fear, the cashier began stacking wads of cash into the teenager's backpack.
"Thanks!" said the teenager when the till was empty, running off outside.
"You ok?" the cashier asked in the direction of where Luca had been standing - but then, suddenly, he realised Luca wasn't there. Adjusting his glasses he wondered where the cute, friendly young boy had gone.

Outside the teenage boy met up with a lookout who had been waiting outside the store. "Let's get out of here!" they said to each other as they took off down the street. Turning a corner, however, they were surprised to see a young boy with a spandex costume on, floating in mid-air directly ahead of them.

"Halt!" called out Luca in an attempt to sound tough.
"Who are you?" asked one of the teenagers.
"I'm the Red Diamond"
"So, you think you're some kind of superhero 'cause you've mastered some kind of levitation trick? Get out of our way before we stab you with this knife!"
Immediately, Luca lifted both boys up by the collars of their shirts with ease and flew upwards. "You guys want to try that again?" asked Luca.
"Argh! Help!" yelled the boys as they tried kicking, punching and stabbing the superpowered preteen to no effect.
"From now on, this city is under my protection, and I don't tolerate any theft, got it?"
"Alright! I won't do it again, I swear!"

Luca let the boys down as the police arrived. Immediately officers were on the scene and apprehended the two criminals, but as soon as they had them, Luca turned invisible and disappeared. The cops were left wondering where the caped flying boy had gone, and the shopkeeper - who had come out to watch the arrest and give the police a statement - was left dumbfounded.

On returning to his shop, the elderly shopkeeper saw Luca inside, having made his selection of sweets.
"Sorry to keep you waiting" stammered the shopkeeper "Just had a bit of a situation happen back there."
"Oh really?" asked Luca innocently.
"Yes - some thugs tried stealing my hard-earned money. But thankfully a superhero came around and stopped them. Would you believe it? A real superhero!"
"You don't say" smiled Luca, his eyes twinkling.

123111111.content:
That evening, Luca hung out around the outskirts of town to practice his powers. The area had some woods and fields of maize, perfect for practicing powers while remaining relatively concealed. Luca had also changed back into his new costume, so he'd grow more used to wearing it while using his powers.

First Luca floated up into the air and practiced flying around. The night air was cool but Luca didn't mind the feeling. He practiced going faster and faster, speeding down towards the Earth faster than gravity would carry him, and suddenly changing direction to fly up towards the sky again. After some time, Luca noticed he was moving so fast, he was leaving a faint blue trail behind him. His cape kept feeling like it was about to come right off, but the whole costume stayed on remarkably well. Macie had done a good job. Luca flew among the trees, darting between them at speed. His agility and speed kept getting better and better while he flew.

Landing again after an intense flying session, but hardly feeling exhausted, Luca caught sight of a pile of giant old logs by the side of the road, likely left there by a logging truck. With a smile, Luca went over and picked up one of the gigantic logs. It was heavily, but Luca could manage it. For fun, Luca tried tossing the log into the air, his super-strong arms tossing the wood like an arrow from a bow, shot into the distance. Concerned about where it might land, Luca raced after the flying log, catching up to it at super speeds and allowing it to drop right into his waiting arms. Luca played catch with himself a few more times, before putting the log back carefully on the pile. Finally, Luca tried lifting the whole pile of logs. This proved much more difficult, as the logs kept rolling down from each other. Instead, Luca had to content himself with lifting an old tractor he found in the woods, which didn't feel that much more challenging than the wood.

Next Luca decided to practice his telekinesis. He set a small leaf on the ground and concentrated hard on it. As before, there seemed to be little effect. The leaf fluttered about in the wind, so Luca had to keep putting it down. It was somewhat distracting, and Luca had the feeling that to really hone his telekinesis power, he had to focus. Finding an even more secluded spot, Luca once again was able to cause the leaf to bend a little, but only after a long period of sitting still and concentrating could he be focused enough to lift the leaf off the ground - and then only by a little. Still, Luca took it as a success and moved to on another power to practice.

Now Luca ran into a maize field at super speeds. Luca had a lot of fun running faster and faster. His whole form seemed a blur as he moved, and he was enjoying it so much that he barely even registered where he was going.

Suddenly Luca reached a clearing. In a split second, Luca could make out a shadow of a grey-bearded man wearing a long brown coat, holding a bright torch in his direction, and an old farm dog beside him.
"Halt!" called the man.
Luca was surprised and stunned at being seen. His eyes opening wide, a bright blue laser shot right out of them, blasting the torch into dust. Luca then almost immediately tripped over in his effort to halt quickly, landing hard on the ground and bouncing along painfully. His body rolled uncontrollably at high speed, as though he was in a high-speed head on collision with a truck, blasting dirt right across the clearing. Finally Luca felt himself slowing down, and ending up in a small ditch beside the man.

The man fumbled in his coat for a moment, and picked a pen light from out of his coat pockets. Shining it at the superpowered boy, he asked "You alright Luca?"
Even in the darkness beyond the man's pen light, Luca's super vision could see him as clearly as under daylight. Luca was shocked at several things - first, how fast he must have been moving. Second, that apparently his eyes could shoot lasers. And third, that some random stranger could have immediately identified his name.
"Who ... are you?" asked Luca, checking that he wasn't injured. Of course, he hadn't sustained any damage at all from the impact, and was able to get up despite feeling a little sore.
The old man smiled. "I own this farm." he explained "You'd better come in with me."

A short walk from the clearing was an old run-down farmhouse. It was not long before the man had given Luca a blanket and some hot coca, and the boy was seated snugly by the roaring fireplace.

"Us farmers have known about them aliens for a long time" explained the man, who had introduced himself as John "Since the first crop circles began appearing across the world, thousands and thousands of years ago, farmers have looked to the skies to protect our food."
"Why do aliens do that?"
"Typically, it isn't intentional. If an alien gets too annoyed, a flying saucer comes down and the farmer is never heard from again. A crop circle is usually just a side-effect of an alien ship coming by for a visit. Indeed, most aliens I've ever met are quite friendly."
"So why don't more people see these aliens?"
"Sometimes they do, but of course, they are scared to speak out. In ancient times they were sometimes called gods. Once there was even a battle fought in the earth skies - something like half a millennium ago, over the city of Nuremberg in Germany. Since then, alien visits have been much more infrequent. People are afraid to speak out, because the aliens ensured that soon after their battle, skepticism would come to the fore again. The aliens began the enlightenment and encouraged people to move away from agriculture, into cities, thus cutting down on sightings. At last, the aliens made Earth a protected planet, so visits are less frequent still."
"What are aliens like?"
"Most of them are a lot like us, just a little more developed, perhaps. They have fantastic technology and much wisdom. Physically they vary a lot, but they're nothing like you."
"Like me?"
"Yes. You're a half-breed - the first ever. Neither aliens nor humans have superpowers, but the combination of the two seems to have had some interesting effects."
"How did you know about me?"
"Your mother first landed out in the maize field where you had been running. Your father was staying over for a year in the bedroom upstairs. He was just a teenager at the time. Your mother was on the run from alien police. I didn't want her here, but your father thought aliens were cool, and the pair struck up a friendship. And what could I do? You don't try to fight an alien. About nine months later, you were born, and she suddenly disappeared. I baptized you in the river, gave your father some money, and advised him to settle down somewhere quiet. Far as I know, she's still on the run, and as an illegal half-breed, the alien police still want you gone. By staying quiet, hopefully, they are less likely to find you."
"What about my grandparents?"
"They know the whole thing too. I think your grandfather died a few years ago. Neither one would recognize you, nor you them. As for your father, well ... after being with an alien, nothing else made him happy again. He tries to find solace in imaginary worlds, and lives for only one thing, the one he loves more than anyone else in the universe."
"My mother?"
"What? No, he hates her for leaving him. He lives for you. He cares about you with all his soul. And never mind your physiology - his dedication, his spirit, his care and his courage are superpowers just as strong as yours."
Luca took another sip of his coca. "So this police force, they're the ones who want me?"
"Actually, I suppose police is a bad choice of word" mused John "Your mother always called them, well, them. She was understandably evasive about it. But the point is this - it is not just you who is in danger. No, for your sake, I believe the punishment on humans in general, and your father in particular, will be much greater. You were born an intergalactic crime."
The words took a moment to sink in for Luca. John smiled.
"But I am sure you can handle it" continued John "Now ... it is getting very late. Your father must be worried about you. I wish you good luck. I am sure we will cross paths again."
"Thank you" said Luca sincerely.
"Oh and, before you go, do me a favor ... don't tell your father that we had this conversation. He'd probably get really mad about it."
"I promise I won't" said Luca, before turning invisible and flying out into the night sky.
123111111.title: Luca keeps honing his powers

1231111111.content:
Luca woke up the next morning feeling as fresh as ever. After slipping into some casual clothes, eating a sandwich for breakfast and brushing his teeth - all while flying around the house to avoid making noise that could wake his father Ben up - Luca left the house as he always did and made for the bus stop with his backpack on. He looked like any ordinary boy around the city, the others on the bus unaware that the polite, friendly child next to them was printed all over the morning newspapers. "Boy with superpowers saves the day!" the headline read "A young child, apparently calling himself the Red Diamond, appears to have developed super powers. Police are grateful to the boy for aiding in the apprehension of two juvenile offenders after an armed robbery yesterday..."

Luca read the paper with his super vision from a faraway newspaper stand out of the bus window, and smiled to himself. He was glad to know that he was making a difference around town.

Soon the bus dropped Luca off at the sports park, and Luca made for the changing rooms to catch up with his soccer team. He changed into the green and white uniform, and put on his worn out guards and cleats.

As soon as the referee's whistle blew, Luca rushed into action. Within a few moments of the start of the game he had easily intercepted the ball and kicked it directly into the opposing team's goal.
"One nil!" declared the referee, blowing his whistle.
"Huh? What just happened?" asked one of the opposing team's strikers.
